title: [Bug]: Error while adding Steam shortcut

title: Bottle name too long = Remove from Library icon out of view
body:
If the name for your bottle is too long, the Remove from Library icon will be out of view (I mistakenly reported the Remove from Library icon as missing about a month ago).

In regards to the character length of the Bottle name:
Up to 21 characters - the bottle name bubble is perfectly placed
22-23 character length - the bottle name bubble starts stretching to the right
max 27 character length - the icon is still somewhat comfortably in view
28-30 character length - the icon is almost out of view but still clickable
31 and beyond - the icon is out of view and unclickable

title: [Bug]: Exception: 'fsr_level'
body:
### Describe the bug

When running a game on latest git with FSR highest quality setting, it throws an exception.

I presume its cause is `fsr_level` _(that got introduced in commit https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/commit/65ca2f7ed4a3e0f62e8f8934e4d987b1d385de4b)_ not being set to any value.

title: [Bug]: Bottles isn't starting when offline
body:
### Describe the bug

Using the flatpak version, Bottles isn't starting when internet connection is off.
It just stops at the opening splash screen, the one where you are notified about fetching new packages, but no message is displayed at all and the program just stay on that screen forever.
Turning on the connection solves the problem, if you close bottles and launch it again it will start normally.
Don't know if it is related to package fetching, it just does not start and shows no messages.

### To Reproduce

1. try to start Bottle with no internet
2. wait
3. nothing happens :)
4. turn on internet
5. start bottles again
6. bottles launches

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

openSUSE Tumbleweed

### Troubleshooting Logs

```shell
I cannot even get to the main window where this info can be collected
```


### Additional context

_No response_

title: [Bug]: DXVK isn't enabled when VKD3D is
body:
### Describe the bug

Currently, Bottles allows you to enable VKD3D without enabling DXVK. However, this breaks VKD3D, as it relies on DXVK's DXGI DLL files.

### To Reproduce

1. Make a new bottle
2. Disable DXVK
3. Enable VKD3D
4. Watch as the bottle refuses to function, at least for software utilizing VKD3D

title: Possible problem with latest DXVK and VKD3D
body:
Hi,
With the latest dxvk and vkd3d update in place of having a new entry called DXVK-XYZ there is a x32 and x64 entry, same for vkd3d.
Also, in ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottle/data/bottles/dxvk, in place of a new folder called dxvk-xyz, there is a x32 and x64 folder.
I think it lack a subfolder, the x32 and x64 folder should be in a directory called dxvk-xyz or vkd3d-xyz.
Thanks you!

title: [Bug]:  Steam Runtime can only be temporarily changed on GUI

title: [Bug]: Newly-added custom executables can't be immediately used
body:
### Describe the bug

When I add a new executable, I can't launch it or change its launch options until I either restart Bottles or rename the executable.

Adding the game and then trying to change the launch options:

```
13:03:50 (INFO) Setting Key 25dce9f7-89f5-4aec-bc70-1270fb7838f6={'executable': 'Borderlands.exe', 'name': 'Borderlands', 'path': '/home/nocifer/Games/Tales from the Borderlands/Borderlands.exe', 'id': '25dce9f7-89f5-4aec-bc70-1270fb7838f6'} for bottle Default… 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/frontend/widgets/program.py", line 134, in show_launch_options_view
    dialog = LaunchOptionsDialog(self, self.config, self.program)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/frontend/windows/launchoptions.py", line 126, in __init__
    self.action_cwd.set_subtitle(program["folder"])
KeyError: 'folder'
```

Trying to launch the executable:

```
13:04:00 (ERROR) Error while running async job: <function ProgramEntry.run_executable.<locals>._run at 0x7fb508bdeb00>
        Exception: 'arguments'
 
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/frontend/utils/threading.py", line 63, in __target
```

title: [Bug]: Bottle with spaces requires relaunching Bottles to remove it
body:
### Describe the bug

It's not exactly a bug, but it used to be removed instantly and it still happens in newest update. When you click "delete bottle" in a bottle with spaces in the name it stays in the menu, but you can see in your file browser that in fact it got removed. You need to relaunch Bottles for it to disappear.

### To Reproduce

1. Create a bottle with spaces in the name, for example "test note pad"
2. Delete it
3. Bottle stays on
4. Close Bottles
5. Launch Bottles again and see your bottles list


### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

Linux Mint 21 Cinnamon

title: [Bug]: Cannot install directplay dependency
body:
### Describe the bug

When attempting to install the 'directplay' dependency from the 'Dependencies' tab in the Bottles GUI, there is an error reported.  The CLI shows:

```
(20:22:08) INFO Installing dependency [directplay] in bottle [test]. 
(20:22:08) WARNING File [dxnt.tar.xz] already exists in temp, skipping. 
patool: Extracting /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/temp/dxnt.tar.xz ...
patool: running /usr/bin/tar --extract --use-compress-program xz --file /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/temp/dxnt.tar.xz --directory /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/temp/dxnt.tar
patool: ... /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/temp/dxnt.tar.xz extracted to `/home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/temp/dxnt.tar'.
Copying dplaysvr.exe to /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/bottles/test/drive_c/windows/syswow64/
[Errno 21] Is a directory: '/home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/bottles/test/drive_c/windows/syswow64/'
```
This was in a 64 bit prefix called 'test'.  I have had a similar error in a 32 bit prefix.


### To Reproduce

1. Create a new bottle
2. Go to Dependencies -> directplay and click the 'download & install this dependency' button

### Package

Other, unofficial package

### Distribution

Fedora 35

### Troubleshooting Logs

```shell
Please note this is the output of 'Health Check' from the About menu item:

Display:
    X.org: true
    X.org (port): :0
    Wayland: false
Graphics:
    vendors:
        nvidia:
            vendor: nvidia
            envs:
                __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD: '1'
                __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME: nvidia
                __VK_LAYER_NV_optimus: NVIDIA_only
            icd: /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_icd.json
```

title: [Bug]: Consolas font installation fails silently
body:

Installing the Consolas font from Dependencies seems to work, but font files are not copied to C/Windows/Fonts, only Registry keys are written.

body:
@mirkobrombin I am still getting this bug in `2022.8.14-brescia`. 

I tried to test the fix for #1855, and it did not work. The 'Add to Steam' action generated a Steam entry with the following command: `bottles:run/Ubisoft-Connect/'Trackmania'`, which failed to launch. 
But when I applied the workaround provided in the OP, editing the command like so: `bottles:run/'Ubisoft Connect'/'Trackmania'` the integration works now, and the game launches.

_Originally posted by @ak-42 in https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/1890#issuecomment-1214400134_

title: [Bug]: "Add to Steam" using wrong bottle name in command when the bottle name has a space in it
body:
### Describe the bug

When the name of a bottle has a space in it, for example `Example Game`, the xdg-open command generated when adding a program to Steam will have the bottle in the command formatted as `Example-Game`, which does not correctly launch the program. The command should instead be formatted with the bottle name as `'Example Game'`, which then runs the program correctly.

### To Reproduce

Make a bottle with a space in it, add a program to the bottle, then add that program to the steam library through the "Add to Steam" feature.

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

SteamOS

title: [Bug]: Adding a program to the library lets Bottles loading forever

labels.name: Can't replicate

body:
### Describe the bug

Adding a program to the Library makes Bottles unusable until `library.yml` is manually deleted.

### To Reproduce

1. Create a bottle, name it `delete me`
2. Manually add a program exe
3. Rename that program exe to the bottle name `delete me`
4. Add that program exe to the Library

<details>
<summary>wrong/old</summary>

1. Have a perfectly working program.
2. Add it to the Library
3. Get notified it was successfully added to your library. But with the terminal open I can see the following error:
    ~~~
    13:47:45 (INFO) Library saved 
    13:47:45 (INFO) Adding new entry to library: 7319cd5a-11e5-4958-8433-caaa44651484 
    13:47:45 (INFO) Library saved 
    13:47:45 (INFO) Library saved 
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/views/library.py", line 55, in update
        entry = LibraryEntry(self, u, e)
      File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/widgets/library.py", line 78, in __init__
        path = ThumbnailManager.get_path(self.config, entry['thumbnail'])
      File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/managers/thumbnail.py", line 32, in get_path
        return ThumbnailManager.__load_grid(config, uri)
      File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/managers/thumbnail.py", line 42, in __load_grid

      File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/utils/manager.py", line 86, in get_bottle_path
        if config.get("Environment") == "Steam":
    AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'
    ~~~
1. Changing to the library tab shows an empty page, Bottles is still usable otherwise.
2. Close Bottles and start Bottles again.
3. Bottles now loads forever, the terminal shows the same error as before.
4. Force quit Bottles and delete the `library.yml`
5. Bottles starts fine again.

</details>

### Package

AUR ("bottles" package)

### Distribution

Arch Linux

### Health Check

title: [Bug]: 'Add to Steam' and 'Add Desktop Entry' do not work for Ubisoft Connect games using the integration.
body:
### Describe the bug

I have a bottle with Ubisoft Connect and a game installed within it, Trackmania 2020. Ubisoft Connect was installed using the installer script from Installers section, and both the Ubisoft Connect and the game were added to the programs list automatically.
Launching both Ubisoft Connect, and the game directly, using the 'play' button in the program list works as expected.

However, if I use 'Add to Steam' functionality on the game's entry, the library entry is correctly created in my steam library, but the game will not launch.
Same goes for 'Add Desktop Entry'. The entry is created, and it shows in KDE menu, but the game will not launch using the newly created entry.
As a workaround, if I add Ubisoft Connect itself using 'Add to Steam' button, it works, but launching directly into the game would be much preferable.

### To Reproduce

1. Install Ubisoft Connect.
2. Install any game (for consistency, try Trackmania, it is free and only a 2 GB download).
3. Try launching the automatically integrated game via Bottles UI. It should work.
4. Select 'Add to Steam' for the game.
5. Try to launch the game via the newly created library entry in Steam. It should not work.

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

Steam Deck/Holo 3.2 (immutable Arch)

title: [Bug]: mscoree.dll not found

labels.name: Can't replicate
labels.description: It's not possible to replicate the issue

body:
### Describe the bug

Could be related to #1701.
After one of the recent updates `mscoree.dll` became inaccessible to my Windows programs.
This behaviour affects a couple of my installed games: Celeste, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel and Borderlands 2. All of them log the same status code as #1701:
```
00d8:err:module:fixup_imports_ilonly mscoree.dll not found, IL-only binary L"Celeste.exe" cannot be loaded
00d8:err:module:LdrInitializeThunk Importing dlls for L"C:\\Program Files\\Epic Games\\Celeste\\Celeste.exe" failed, status c0000135
```
`dotnet35` is also no longer installable on my machine (setup fails after starting the installation), but I'm not certain if the issues are linked.

I already tried creating all kinds of bottles (x64, x32, GE-Proton etc.) and reinstalling Bottles itself by running `flatpak uninstall com.usebottles.bottles --delete-data && flatpak install com.usebottles.bottles` (I backed up the game installs beforehand so that I wouldn't have to reinstall them). Eventually I also tried the RPM version of Bottles provided by Fedora, which ended up being almost two months behind upstream Bottles (I know, yuck ;D), but ran Celeste just fine after installing `mono` in the dependencies tab.

### To Reproduce

1. Install the latest version of Bottles from Flathub
2. Create a new bottle
3. Install `mono` in the dependencies tab.
4. Optionally copy a program into the Windows sandbox (in my case Celeste since it doesn't have DRM)
5. Launch the program in the terminal and observe `mscoree.dll not found`

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

Fedora 36

title: [Bug]: Inception folders created into Bottle environment
body:
### Describe the bug

When creating an new Bottle, it looks take forever, but inception folder are created (about millions if you keep running long time).

### To Reproduce

1. Remove or rename data folder (~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles).
2. Open Bottles app, go over welcome screen and create new Bottle (e.g. with name "Test").
3. Select Game environment and click Create.
4. Wait until all dependancies are downloaded and Bootle finished to be created.
5. Open the Bootle, access to three dot menu and Delete the Bottle.
6. Create one time again a new Game Bootle then put any name you want (e.g. "Test)
7. Click on create, the wiard indicated "Model founded" and stuck on this step.
8. Don't wait too much time otherwise it will take fovever to remove the folder (about 1 million folder ~= 5 minutes with very fast SSD). Use xkill to kill Bottle.
9. Look into folder ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Test and just do find, you will see the problem, many folders Videos created inside Videos. `./drive_`

Flatpak from Flathub

title: [Bug]: unable to launch an executable from a prefix with a colon in the name
body:
### Describe the bug

Bottles is unable to launch an executable from a bottle with a colon in the name. Perhaps this is not allowed because in some Windows version and/or filesystems «:» is an illegal character and the directory of the bottle is created with a colon in the name.

### To Reproduce

1. Download [Smile Guide: The Apple Escape](https://krainagrzybowtv.itch.io/smileguide).
2. Create a bottle with the name «Smile Guide: The Apple Escape». Note the «:» character in the name.
3. Place the executable of the game SmileGuide.exe in a directory inside the bottle. The game needs no installation.
4. Try to launch the executable. You will see that bottles is unable to launch the file.

If I do the same without «:» in the name of the bottle, the game starts successfully.

### Describe the bug

When I try to run a game inside a bottle with the 'OBS Vulkan Capture' option enabled, OBS does not capture the game.

### To Reproduce

1. Install any game that can use DXVK (that is, runs on DirectX 10 or 11) into a bottle.
2. Go to 'Preferences' and toggle the 'OBS Vulkan Capture' option to on.
3. Start the game.
4. Try to use 'Game Capture' in OBS to capture the footage.
5. Observe that it fails.

### Package

title: [Bug]: mscoree.dll disabled after installing Mono
body:
### Describe the bug

In a follow-up of https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/1697, I think I found a related bug that I couldn't pin-point first.

When a user installs the Mono-dependency, there is still an error when trying to run an application:

```
010c:err:module:fixup_imports_ilonly mscoree.dll not found, IL-only binary L"WarZone.exe" cannot be loaded
010c:err:module:LdrInitializeThunk Importing dlls for L"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\TW Warzone Fin\\WarZone.exe" failed, status c0000135
```

### To Reproduce

1. Install a C&C game like[ War Zone that uses a .NET wrapper](https://www.moddb.com/mods/tiberian-sun-warzone/downloads/tiberian-war-warzone)

title: [Bug]: Problems with program options menu
body:
### Describe the bug

When you click the "3 dots" button on any program in your programs list there are few problems:

1. It stays on when you click "browse path" or "launch with terminal" button
2. It doesn't allow you to press print screen button to make a screenshot
3. "Remove from list" button doesn't work at all - except when you user it on a hidden program then it puts the program back into the list.
4. It takes focus from all the windows and bars that you have - I can't click on any icons on my taskbar and I can't click on any windows that were opened when you use "open with terminal" button


### To Reproduce

1. Open Bottles
2. Go to your installed programs in any bottle

title: [Bug]: New file/directory selection screen no longer follows symbolic links
body:
### Describe the bug

Before 2022.6.14-brescia-1, the file/folder selection dialogue used for running an exe or setting a working directory would allow the user to follow symbolic links. This is useful, as symbolic linking allows users to move storage intensive files like games to a different drive with more storage, and simply leave a link behind. Such solutions have worked reliably for me for months, and I have never encountered any issues attributable to symbolic link usage.

After 2022.6.14-brescia-1, the new file/folder selection dialogue no longer follows the symbolic links, but simply treats them like a file. This means that if a link is selected while trying to run the exe, the symbolic link file will simply be selected as if it was a file, rather than being followed to the new location.

Could you please consider reverting this regressed behaviour to the previous solution?

### To Reproduce

1. Create a new bottle, with any successfully executing Windows program in it.
2. Move the exe (or the folder containing it) to a new location, either on the same storage device, or another one.
3. Create a symbolic link pointing to exe in the new location, and leave it in the old location.
4. Select 'run an exe' and try to navigate to the exe via the symbolic link. You will find that you cannot follow the symbolic link.
5. Alternatively, try setting the working directory of the bottle to where the exe is, by following the symbolic link. It can no longer be done.
6. (Optional) Run the program via the standard program shortcut. It will still work via the symbolic link, as expected.

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

Steam Deck (immutable Arch)

### Health Check


body:
### Describe the bug

I had some problems starting a game with gamescope which also has launch options containing `-show-screen-selector`.
Gamescope tells me
~~~
/usr/bin/gamescope: invalid option -- 's'
~~~
which might indicate the launch option is being picked up by the gamescope command - hinting the `--` might be missing.

### To Reproduce

1. View `gamescope --help`
    ~~~
    usage: gamescope [options...] -- [command...]
    ~~~
2. Compare with the actual command line.
    * With launch option:
        ~~~
        echo "%command%" > ~/tmp.txt
        ~~~
    * In the code:
        https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/blob/6e4e1dfcad27d46c479d553b685951333355e075/src/backend/wine/winecommand.py#L384
3. Notice the `--` is missing between the gamescope command and the actual program command.

### Package

AUR ("bottles" package)

### Distribution

Arch linux

### Health Check

```shell
Display:
    X.org: true
    X.org (port): :1
    Wayland: false
Graphics:
    vendors:
        nvidia:
            vendor: nvidia
            envs:
                __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD: '1'
                __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME: nvidia
                __VK_LAYER_NV_optimus: NVIDIA_only
            icd: /usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_icd.json
    prime:
        integrated: null
        discrete: null
Kernel:
    Type: Linux
    Version: 5.17.9-arch1-1
Distro:
    Name: Arch Linux
    Version: Unknown
Disk:
    Total: 116976529408
    Free: 7168528384
RAM:
    MemTotal: 11.6GiB
    MemAvailable: 7.1GiB
Tools:
    cabextract: true
    p7zip: true
    patool: true
    glibc_min: '2.35'
Bottles_envs: null
```


### Display Protocol

X11

### Display Backend used by Bottles

X11

### Additional context

Changing the mentioned code line fixed the issue:

~~~ diff
- command = f"{self.__get_gamescope_cmd(return_steam_cmd)} {command}" 
+ command = f"{self.__get_gamescope_cmd(return_steam_cmd)} -- {command}" 
~~~

title: [Bug]: Installer menu shortcuts are not working properly
body:
### Describe the bug

When running an installer the appropriated launcher is added to the systems start menu.  
However those are do have a wrong launch argument: it list the main exe twice as like:

```
bottles -e '/home/vortex/.local/share/bottles/bottles/battlenet/drive_c/Program Files (x86)/Battle.net/Battle.net.exe/Battle.net.exe' -b 'battlenet'
```

To fix this the 2nd occurrence of the exe must be removed.  
Furthermore the short cuts are not categorized and list as "not associated" in KDE at least.  
And last but not lest they do not have icons. (At least not in KDE).

Here is a screenshot, I already fixed Battle.net, Origin and GOG but left the EA Client untouched
![Screenshot_20220603_121326](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11244092/171835391-b138196c-1735-4699-8445-cb9cc3192d8f.png)

"Nicht Zugeordnet" is German for not associated.  
Here it would be nice if it would be added to "Wine" or a new category Bottles would be created.

### To Reproduce

1. Installer
2. Choose any installer from the list (tested Gog Galaxy, Origin, Battle.net, EA Client)
3. Wait for the installation to complete
4. Test the start menu short cut (on KDE: Not associated -> installed software name)

title: [Bug]: Steam Shortcuts do not handle spaces in programme name correctly
body:
### Describe the bug

Currently, adding a shortcut to Steam via the "Add to Steam" will create the shortcut with the form `xdg-open bottles:run/BOTTLENAME/PROGRAMMENAME` .This however causes causes issues if `PROGRAMMENAME` includes spaces. 

I therefore think adding the quotation marks in the `SteamManager.add_shortcut()` should solve the issue. I tried doing it myself, but couldn't find the `config` dict and don't really know what it does.

Pressing "Add to Steam" for a programme named "A Short Hike" located in a bottle called "Hella Testing" will a create a shortcut executing the command `xdg-open bottles:run/Hella-Testing/A Short Hike` which results in `xdg-open: unexpected argument 'Short'`.However, executing `xdg-open bottles:run/Hella-Testing/'A Short Hike'` works as expected.

title: [Bug]: Bottles crashes if the bottles' folder has an empty folder inside
body:
### Describe the bug

I like having my bottles folder in my home directory, and to easily identify the folder, I gave it Bottle's program icon.

However, apparently Bottles sees the .directory file that is created for this purpose inside the folder, and tries to open it as a bottle directory and search for the bottle.yml file that would be inside, which prompts the following error:

`Error while running async job: <function MainWindow.__on_start.<locals>.get_manager at 0x7f00528c1e50>
        Exception: [Errno 20] Not a directory: '/home/aura/Bottles/.directory/bottle.yml'`

Apparently, this crash occurs if there is anything in the bottles directory besides a bottle.

I would expect Bottles to ignore hidden files, or at least the .directory file specifically.

### To Reproduce

1. Create any file in the bottles directory (in this case, a .directory file created by Dolphin)

title: [Bug]: Bottles Hangs on get_processes
body:
### Describe the bug

Every time `get_processes` is called (determined by watching terminal output and seeing `(INFO) Using Wine debug tool -- get_processes` printed during the hangs), Bottles hangs for about half a second.

In my experience, it is called when a Bottle's section is opened, when the Programs list is updated via adding or removing a Program from the list, and most noticeably, when opening *and* closing the "Change launch options" dialog for a Program. It appears to call this twice for each Program in the Bottle's list, meaning for each Program, the bottle will hang for about a second.

My heaviest Bottle has 7 Programs, so it hangs for 7 seconds every time one of the above triggers. This can add up and cause frustration.

### To Reproduce

Open a Bottle from the main window.

### Package

AUR ("bottles" package)

### Distribution

Arch Linux

### Health Check

```shell
Display:
    X.org: true
```

title: [Crash report]  'NoneType' object has no att (Steam Prefix)
body:
Hi! I'm experiencing this issue after checking Steam Proton Prefixes in Experiments settings. While I fully understand this feature is experimental and this crash report is quite generic (might have something to do with my Steam setup as well), the fact that Bottles refuses to launch due to this fault in Bottles' early launch stages was quite troubling. 

Initially I thought Bottles would have a standalone, user-global configuration file under ~/.local/bottles and spent quite a while trying to find a global configuration file for Bottles and failed, then I read `window.py` and realized Bottles uses the GtkSettings API. As a mainly KDE/Qt user I wasn't very aware of its existence and had very little experience with `gsettings`. For anyone with the same issue, the trouble was solved with: 

```
$ gsettings set com.usebottles.bottles experiments-steam false
```

And I believe this has reverted my configuration setup. While all these very much are my own problems, it would be quite nice to document this behavior just in case someone else has a wrong setup and cannot revert it from Bottles GUI, since the error prevents the GUI from launching at all. 

---

This crash report was generated by Bottles.

**Details**
* **package**: Other
* **version**: 2022.5.14-trento-3


**Log**
```python3
'NoneType' object has no attribute 'items'  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/utils/threading.py", line 64, in __target
```

title: [Bug]: Arguments are ignored when using the --program option
body:
### Describe the bug

I am using the `bottles-cli` tool to run games directly from .desktop shortcut (which I am then adding to a Steam).
I want to run a launcher (Ubisoft Connect in this case) and pass an argument to it that will directly open my game.

This does not work:
```
flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles run -b Ubi -p "Ubisoft Connect" -a "uplay://launch/5595/0"
```
It just opens the ubisoft connect. Does not pass the arguments provided with `-a` option.

This does work:
```
flatpak run --command=bottles-cli com.usebottles.bottles run -b Ubi -e "/home/deck/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Ubi/drive_c/Program Files (x86)/Ubisoft/Ubisoft Game Launcher/upc.exe" -a "uplay://launch/5595/0"
```
And opens the Ubisoft Connect launcher, which is then immediately launching my game.

### To Reproduce

1. Install any program in the bottle with "Installers" option
2. Try to run that program from bottles-cli, with the `-p PROGRAM -a ARGUMENTS` options
3. ARGUMENTS are being ignored

Stuck on the welcome screen. Program starts fine, it just seems that the Next button doesn't work. Exit does, but unfortunately it exits the entire application instead of just the welcome screen.

title: [Bug]: Installing to "C:\GoG Games\...." breaks bottles.
body:
### Describe the bug

Basically, exactly what the title says. The bottle won't automatically recognize programs installed to "C:\GoG Games\...." and after closing the bottle, it becomes impossible to reopen. title: [Bug]: Launch options are ignored when using a windows path
body:
### Describe the bug

If the `path` of an external program is a windows path launch options are ignored.

### To Reproduce

1. Create a new clean bottle.
2. Close bottles and insert the following test values in the `bottle.yml`:
    ~~~ yml
    External_Programs:
        test_unix:
            arguments: notify-send "test" && %command%
            executable: test.exe
            name: Test Unix
            path: /test/path/test.exe
        test_win:
            arguments: notify-send "test" && %command%
            executable: test.exe
            name: Test Win
            path: C:\test\path\test.exe
    ~~~
1. Start bottles, switch to the bottle and try to start the examples.
2. The Unix example spawns a new test notification while the windows example doesn't.

title: What is the purpose of versioning (it seems broken)

labels.name: Feedback
labels.description: Feedback from the community.

body:
This issue is between feedback and bug report i don't know...

I had hard time to understand what is the purpose of versioning and i'm confused. 

At first i hoped this could allow me to create some kind of snapshot of the entire bottle (wineprefix files and conf), which could allow me to revert back the wineprefix in a previous state if, for example, i install a new program which broke the bottle (lib files overrides, corrupted registry.. the usual windows stuff).

First time i test, it seems no changes are detected when i create a new state. If i revert back to a previous state, it does not change anything on the files in the bottle, installed programs etc. What's more, the manifest is always empty:

```
Additions: []
Changes: []
Removed: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:37.659611'
```

So i took care to read the documentation and now i'm confused as it seems, according to the example, that only dependencies installed through Bottles UI seems to be tracked. So i took a test by installing the dependency "andale32". A state has been created automatically but the manifest is empty again.

I then created manually another state because previous one seems to have been created "before" the installation of the dependency (as the name of the state suggests it: `before andale32`...). But again the manifest is completely empty.

i then took a look at the states yml files and directory inside the bottle directory out of curiosity, and they seems empty:

```
[ben@dellxps13 states]$ tree
.
├── 0
│   ├── drive_c
│   ├── files.yml
│   └── index.yml
├── 1
│   ├── drive_c
│   ├── files.yml
│   └── index.yml
├── 2
│   ├── drive_c
│   ├── files.yml
│   └── index.yml
├── index.yml
└── states.yml
```

```
[ben@dellxps13 states]$ cat states.yml 
States:
    '0':
        Comment: first run
        Creation_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:14.115649'
    1:
        Comment: before andale32
        Creation_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:37.660226'
    2:
        Comment: mcgee
        Creation_Date: '2022-05-06 19:50:47.726824'
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:50:47.726830'
```

```
[ben@dellxps13 states]$ cat index.yml 
Files: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:50:47.724892'
```


Simple cat of every yml files inside numbered folders:
```
[ben@dellxps13 states]$ cat **/*.yml
Files: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:14.112384'
Additions: []
Changes: []
Removed: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:14.112653'
Files: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:37.658831'
Additions: []
Changes: []
Removed: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:39:37.659611'
Files: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:50:47.724892'
Additions: []
Changes: []
Removed: []
Update_Date: '2022-05-06 19:50:47.725961'
```

Something seems broken here but more generally i don't really understand what to expect from this feature. Looks like this should at least deserve a more in depth explanation in the documentation.

title: [Bug]: DLL overrides from dialog don't work
body:
### Describe the bug

There's the possibility to set dll overrides for a bottle but they won't get assigned when starting a program.

### To Reproduce

1. Find a configuration of bottle and executable which makes it easy to spot if a dll-override is assigned.
  For my testing I've used an existing Valve Proton prefix which already includes dxvk with a game that's clearly running better with dxvk turned on - the dxvk hud can help here too.
  It'll get a 50 FPS boost when using dxvk for which it needs the following overrides: `d3d11=n;d3d10core=n;d3d9=n;dxgi=n`.
1. Spot overrides not working:
    1. Set up dll-overrides in the bottles options menu. See figure 1.
    2. Start the program and notice that the overrides didn't get applied:
        * The performance is bad,
        * The dxvk hud doesn't show up.
4. Test the other way around to pinpoint that the override system is indeed the problem:
    1. Set up a new environment variable named `WINEDLLOVERRIDES` and assign the same dll overrides. See figure 2.
    2. Start the program and notice that the overrides get applied:
        * The performance is way better.
        * The dxvk hud shows up. 
1. Conclude that dll overrides work as an environment variable and don't work as a dedicated dll override which should be a bug.

<details>
<summary>Figure 1</summary>

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408843/166158336-939fedd8-abcf-4683-abcf-c93902090a25.png)

</details>

<details>

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1408843/166158575-1e9430b7-4e2e-43b6-ad52-33d62402d59d.png)

</details>

title: [Bug]:  Intermittent esync issues breaking installers
body:
### Describe the bug

When esync is enabled by an installer, it intermittently causes all further steps to fail:

```
(15:24:17) INFO Adding Key: [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Wine\DllOverrides] with Value: [dxgi] and Data: [native,builtin] in 7h-test registry 
(15:24:17) INFO Using WINE debug tool -- get_processes 
(15:24:17) INFO Using WINE Registry CLI -- add 
(15:24:17) INFO reg: The operation completed successfully

 
(15:24:17) INFO Using WINE Runtime tool -- send_status(-u) 
wine: configuration in L"/home/simon/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/7h-test" has been updated.
(15:24:19) INFO Setting Key: [dxvk] to [True] for bottle: [7h-test]… 
(15:24:19) INFO Setting Key: [sync] to [esync] for bottle: [7h-test]… 
(15:24:20) INFO Using WINE Runtime tool -- send_status(-k) 
(15:24:20) INFO Setting Key: [discrete_gpu] to [True] for bottle: [7h-test]… 
(15:24:20) INFO Executing installer steps 
Downloading SteamSetup.exe: 100% [==================================================>

(15:24:20) INFO Launching an executable… 
06e4:err:esync:esync_init Failed to open esync shared memory file; make sure no stale wineserver instances are running without WINEESYNC.
```

This leaves the Bottle in an inconsistent state:
 * Bottles thinks that the installer completes & registers the Steam shortcut
 * Steam installer failed to launch, so the shortcut silently fails

2. Create empty "Custom" bottle
3. Attempt to install Steam installer

title: [Bug]: Parameters when depending on Installers don't resolve as expected.
body:
### Describe the bug

If you have an installer that uses dependant `installers` (e.g. Steam), if `Parameters` conflict - these do not resolve as expected.

In this specific example - Steam has DXVK enabled, which causes blackscreens in the app i'm building the installer for. As a result, in my installer, I have DXVK off.

I'd expect that the Parameters in the top level installer to take precedence & before any of the `Dependencies` are installed

What results is Bottles enabling the Parameters from the Steam installer, while glossing over the ones in the top-level installer. These parameters provided by Steam impact the `Dependencies`, which introduces instability. Bottles claims DXVK is disabled, but in reality this is not the case - the app Blackscreens on launch, consistent with DXVK still being on. Only if I toggle DXVK on and back off, does the setting take effect & the app work as expected. 


### To Reproduce

Attempt to use the following installer in a clean "Custom" bottle:

```
Name: 7th Heaven
Description: Modding platform for Final Fantasy 7
Arch: win64

Installers:
- [ steam ]

Dependencies:
- vcredist2019
- dotnet48
- d3dcompiler_43
- d3dcompiler_47

Parameters:
  dxvk: false
  sync: esync
  discrete_gpu: true
  
Executable:
  name: 7th Heaven
  icon: 7th.png
  file: 7th Heaven.exe
  path: Program Files (x86)/7th Heaven/7th Heaven.exe
  
Steps:
- action: install_exe
  file_name: 7thHeaven-v2.4.0.0_Release.exe
  url: https://github.com/tsunamods-codes/7th-Heaven/releases/download/2.4.0/7thHeaven-v2.4.0.0_Release.exe
  file_checksum: d7646ff9cd55e9506817d0cc51e0e51c

  ```

title: [Bug]: Desktop entry doesnt work if bottles name is changed
body:
### Describe the bug

When a bottle is created it gets a name and a path. The name is the thing that;s displayed in the UI, while the path i the name of the wine prefix directory.

When a bottle is renamed only the names is changed. This is fine in my opinion.

The issue is that the desktop entry creator function assumes that the name and path is always the same. This is most defiantly not the case.

title: [Bug]: Problems running games without installers
body:
### Describe the bug

Bottles or wine in particular (I don't know which of the two), they have a problem in flatpak for the execution of portable games (without installer) I tried this in 3 different games to verify if it was not the fault of a particular game, then the I tried all 3 in wine on the system and all 3 worked. After doing different tests, I came to the conclusion that in the isolated environment created by the bottle (flatpak) no game that does not have an installer works, this means games that come uncompressed and only have to open the .exe, the The only solution to open these games was, Create a folder in /home, with flatseal give permissions to bottles to read the home, and through the "programs" tab add the game manually from there, and then I could run it normally, if I tried executing the .exe on the default button always produced an error. This only happens with games that don't have an installer, for some reason games with an installer work fine (some don't), but the steps I explained above solve all the problems.

![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84112405/164975381-5c5671ee-458f-499f-8251-094283e3b8a2.png)
Default button that does not work in portable .exe's

---
![imagen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84112405/164975416-2fa1cea4-79e3-476d-b8d4-4cc65ffd613c.png)
This is where I was able to add it manually and get it working

title: [Bug]: The .bat scripts doesn't like spaces in path
body:
### Describe the bug

If a run a .bat script to open a .exe and if there is any space on the path, the script doesn't find the .exe on the same folder

Example :  ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/gaming1/drive_c/Games/adi 2/launch.bat

If i remove any space on the path, it finds the .exe 

Example :  ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/gaming1/drive_c/Games/adi2/launch.bat

Some old games like mugen have the same problem if there is any space on the executable name. (it doesn't find the data on the same folder), but rename the .exe without space works.

Maybe a problem with the working path resolver?

title: [Bug]: flatpak: Can't launch multible applications from terminal
body:
### Describe the bug

Launching a single application from bottles cli individually works fine.
But when I open a second terminal and try to launch another application, after around 20 seconds I get the error:
_"Failed to register: Timeout was reached"_

For example:
**Terminal A:**
`/usr/bin/flatpak run -v com.usebottles.bottles -b Win-Apps -e "<FULLPATH>/drive_c/SpeedCrunch/speedcrunch.exe"`
**Terminal B:**
`/usr/bin/flatpak run -v com.usebottles.bottles -b Win-Apps -e "<FULLPATH>/drive_c/Firefox Portable ESR/FirefoxPortable.exe"`

Shell output:
The error occures after:
`F: Running 'bwrap --args 41 bottles -b Win-Apps -e '/home/user/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Win-Apps/drive_c/Firefox Portable ESR/FirefoxPortable.exe''`
And aborts before the first INFO stage, which would usually be like:
`(xx:xx:xx) INFO Performing Bottles checks...`

### To Reproduce

Open two terminals, on the first start any Wine application like this:
`/usr/bin/flatpak run -v com.usebottles.bottles -b Win-Apps -e "/home/user/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Win-Apps/drive_c/SpeedCrunch/speedcrunch.exe"`
This works fine.

Now open a second terminal and try to launch another application:
`/usr/bin/flatpak run -v com.usebottles.bottles -b Win-Apps -e "/home/user/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Win-Apps/drive_c/Firefox Portable ESR/FirefoxPortable.exe"`
This will hang / and abort after around 20 seconds.

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

### Distribution

Debian 11 x64 stable, latest upgrades as of this date.

title: [Bug]: versioning tool does not preserve symlinks
body:
### Describe the bug

I use symlinks inside bottles to share data between prefixes as well as expose it in appropriate places. eg.
`C:/users/steamuser/Documents/` pointing to `~/Wine`
or
`C:/Program Files (x86)/GOG Galaxy/Games` inside GOG Galaxy prefix pointing to `~/Games/GOG`
so that a game could be launched inside a separate prefix.

When I tried to create new state using the versioning tool Bottles starting copying data the symlinks point to. In order to create a backup Bottles should honor symlinks.

### To Reproduce

1. have a symlink inside the bottle
2. in the "versioning" click on "create new state"
3. Bottles does not replicate symlinks but copies their destination

### Package

Flatpak from Flathub

Fedora Silverblue

title: [Bug]: Launch from Terminal cannot handle spaces in path
body:
### Describe the bug

When using the 'Launch from terminal' option, programs at a location with spaces anywhere in the path will lead to FileNotFoundError.

`Failed to execute child process “bash -c /usr/bin/mangohud /usr/bin/gamemoderun  /home/<user>/.local/share/bottles/runners/GE-Proton7-10/files/bin/wine64 C:GOG”: Failed to execve: No such file or directory`

Since the play button succesfully launches the (GOG) game, I expected the game to succesfully launch with Launch from Terminal as well.

### To Reproduce

I tried 4 GOG games, all working normally, but experiencing the same bug when launched with terminal.

- Create a Gaming bottle
- Install any windows GOG game (all games will use 'C:/GOG Games' in their path)
- Launch from 'Play button' to see the game starting succesfully
- Close the game
- Click the menu next to the play button, then select Launch with Terminal
- Pop-up will show the FileNotFoundError (The error shows it tries to find C:/GOG, which indeed does not exist.)

### Package

Other, unofficial package

### Distribution

Fedora 35

title: [Bug]: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'connect'
body:
### Describe the bug

When trying to run bottles I get the following traceback:
```
$ bottles
(19:11:17) INFO Performing Bottles checks... 
(19:11:17) INFO Runners found:
	 - sys-wine-7.4
 
(bottles:18576): Gtk-CRITICAL **: 19:11:17.471: Error building template class 'DetailsPrograms' for an instance of type 'DetailsPrograms': .:25:1 Invalid object type 'HdyStatusPage'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/main.py", line 166, in do_command_line
    self.do_activate()
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/main.py", line 231, in do_activate
    win = MainWindow(
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/window.py", line 115, in __init__
    page_details = DetailsView(self)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/views/details.py", line 58, in __init__
    self.view_programs = ProgramsView(self, config)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/views/bottle_programs.py", line 50, in __init__
    self.btn_add.connect("clicked", self.add)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'connect'
```
The main window occurs but none of the buttons are functional.
This happens with 2022.03.14 but I've tried version back till November last year and they show the same issue.

This same bug was mentioned in [#768](https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/768#issuecomment-986313209) but it wasn't the original bug reported in that issue and that issue is now closed.

I'm on gentoo, so it might very well be something specific about my setup. I was unable to find a list of dependencies in the repo. The code is python but there's no `setup.py`, `setup.cfg` or `pyproject.toml` I could look at to check the required (Python) packages. Did I miss a file somewhere listing the dependencies?
I did check the package in the AUR and all dependencies are installed, but that doesn't tell me anything about minimum or maximum required versions, so could still be a version issue.

The ebuild (gentoo "package") I used to install bottles can be found here https://github.com/gentoo-mirror/src_prepare-overlay/blob/master/app-emulation/bottles/bottles-20220314_p3.ebuild.

dxvk-1.10  <-----------------------

title: [BUG] Not knowing the path /media [Solved]
body:
Hello. Thanks for making this software.
The software does not know all the root routes. 
For example, it does not know the path of the /media.

![Screenshot from 2022-03-11 17-43-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62870048/157884574-7fc23b48-75f3-4308-927c-eabb2fb904ce.png)

Therefore, I have to use the following command to install the game from an external hard drive.
```bash
WINEPREFIX="/<route>" wine install-file.exe
```
Thank you for your help.

title: [BUG] LatencyFleX can be enabled despite the system is missing the Vulkan layer
body:
**Describe the bug**
LatencyFleX support need a vulkan layer to works. Currently there is no check for these and it will just silently fails.

**Fix**
- Check for common paths, if missing just disable the switcher
- Inject them directly in the environment, so the user don't need to install theme manually (need testing)

**Expected behavior**
Should not be enabled if the layer is missing.

**Additional context**
Doesn't hit the Flatpak as LatencyFleX vulkan layer came with the installation.

title: [BUG] ValueError: unknown url type: '' when offline
body:
2022.2.28-trento-4 FLATPAK
No errors seen in logs.

I update to latest version "2022.2.28-trento-4" and when I started Bottles (with no internet) application screen is now empty and white except for the top "menu" bar that says I am offline and click to connect and see settings.

I was using dark mode before so not sure why it would change to light mode even if offline. I cannot see any bottles or anything.

I was able to downgrade to previous version "2022.2.28-trento-3" and lucky nothing was lost. very scary moment hahahahahaha thought i lost all of my games and saves.

I tried upgrading and had the same issue. The "Fixed a regression with offline mode" must have introduced new regression.

title: [BUG] Running a .EXE (extension capitalized) file causes "Unsupported executable type" error
body:
**Describe the bug**
When running a Windows executable where the extension is fully capitalized (.EXE vs. the standard .exe), Bottles reports in the console that the executable is unsupported. Renaming the same file to .exe allows it to run correctly. 

**Installation**
 - Method: AUR
 - Version: 2022.2.28-trento-3

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Download a known working Windows executable (for my test I used the 64 bit Firefox 98.0 installer for Windows, with filename `Firefox Setup 98.0.exe`).
2. Rename the file and capitalize the extension (The installer I used was renamed to `Firefox Setup 98.0.EXE`).
3. Run Bottles from the command line and create a default Application container.
4. Click "Run Executable", and run the renamed executable.
5. The console will display an error similar to the one displayed in the screenshot below, and the application will not run.

**Expected behavior**
I expected the executable file to run normally, the same as an executable with a lowercase extension. The .EXE naming convention is common with legacy Windows software (in my case Office 2003), and it seems like expected behavior to be able to run an exe file, regardless of capitalization.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79222678/157341258-53f2c91b-6205-4c44-8120-edd044aeef41.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Endeavour OS
 - Version N/A (rolling release)
 - Display server: Xorg
 - DE: Cinnamon
 - Shell: Fish

title: [BUG] Auto-detecting path to wine bin folder
body:
This hotfix was recently released, which treats any runner with "Proton" in the name as a Proton runner:

- https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/commit/add43b4f8b23d58e05d20290d174fdd45c58d0b7

This issue is related. The official Proton runners use a "files" or "dist" folder:

- https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/1099

But, the GloriousEggroll improved versions of Proton/Wine don't use any folder at all. `bin` is directly under the runner-folder.

- I personally use the Wine-GE-Proton. GloriousEggroll took Proton, removed the Steam-code that makes Proton break outside of Steam, and then rebased Wine-staging and other game patches on top of the De-Steamed Proton. As a result it's the best of all worlds, truly the best game compatibility of all runners I've used: https://github.com/GloriousEggroll/wine-ge-custom/releases/
- As mentioned, that release now contains "Proton" in the name, but doesn't use dist/files subfolders.
- Therefore, I get `~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/runners/lutris-GE-Proton7-6-x86_64/files/bin/wine64: No such file or directory` from Bottles.
- Recently, a new commit was also merged which brings in that exact Wine-GE-Proton, which will trigger this bug since that version lacks dist/files subfolders: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/components/pull/116
- My temporary fix: I manually created a `files` folder (that's what the public version of Bottles looks for).

## Proposed solution:

Perhaps use Python's `pathlib.Path.glob()` and look for this pattern:

- Create a `Path(path to the wine runner's main folder)` object.
- Search its subfolders via `thatpathobject.glob(r"**/bin/wine64")`. This would return a list of all paths that were found anywhere in the runner's directory tree.
- Next, loop through all matches and pick the shortest path (in case of multiple matches).

Something like that may solve this forever.

title: [BUG] Race condition launching applications from CLI
body:
**Describe the bug**
Using the command line `flatpak run com.usebottles.bottles -e 'C:\Program Files\Program\Program.exe' -b 'Bottle'`  exits immediately after the warning `WARNING Windows path detected. Avoiding validation.`.  If the `-b` argument is removed, Bottles will launch to the bottle list with `Run Here` buttons as expected. Running with no arguments also launches Bottles as expected. Specified program and bottle configuration appear to be irrelevant and this same command with an identically configured bottle appears to work fine on Ubuntu 20.04.

This appears to also prevent all .desktop files created by Bottles from working.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install Fedora Silverblue 35 and Bottles flatpak
2. Launch Bottles and create a bottle called 'Applications'
3. Install PuTTY x86 64-bit from https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/latest.html
4. `flatpak run com.usebottles.bottles -e 'C:\Program Files\PuTTY\putty.exe' -b 'Applications'` 
5. Bottles exits without ever launching the application

**Expected behavior**
The specified program should launch in the specified bottle

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora Silverblue
 - Version 35
 - Display server: Wayland (same behavior on X.org)
 
**Additional context**
Flatpak 1.12.3
Bottles 2022.2.28-trento-2

title: [BUG] "Desktop Entry" Shortcut Doesn't Run Program with Arguments as Launching from Within Bottles
body:
**Describe the bug**
First reported in the forum, "["Desktop Entry" Shortcut Doesn't Run Program with Options](https://forums.usebottles.com/d/64-desktop-entry-shortcut-doesnt-run-program-with-options)"

**Installation**

1. Close Bottles
1. Run the new Bottle program from the desktop shortcut
1. Note that MangoHud is not running with the game as it does when launching when Bottles is running
1. Note that Gamemode is not running by checking the status from a terminal using `gamemode -s`

**Expected behavior**
When running the Bottle program from a desktop shortcut:
1. MangoHud *should be* running as an overlay with the game, the same behavior as if it were launched from the program configuration when Bottles is running
1. Gamemode *should be* running with the game, , the same behavior as if it were launched from the program configuration when Bottles is running.  The status of Gamemode may be verified from a terminal using the `gamemode -s` command

**Screenshots**

title: [BUG] Bottle doesn't work anymore if programs with special in character is installed
body:
**Describe the bug**
When installing an application that contains a special character "®" the corresponding bottle can't be opened anymore and the following message is shown on the console.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/views/list.py", line 149, in show_details
    self.window.show_details_view(config=self.config)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/window.py", line 291, in show_details_view
    self.page_details.set_config(config)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/views/details.py", line 176, in set_config
    self.view_programs.update(config=config)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/views/bottle_programs.py", line 120, in update
    programs = self.manager.get_programs(self.config)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/managers/manager.py", line 633, in get_programs
    executable_path = self.__getLnkData(program)
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/managers/manager.py", line 542, in __getLnkData
    return content[-1].decode(decode)
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xae in position 23: invalid start byte
```

The issue seems to be caused by a `.lnk` file in `drive_c/ProgramData/Microsoft/Windows/Start Menu/Programs`.

Looking at https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/blob/master/src/backend/managers/manager.py#L546 the file seems to be decoded as `utf-8`, which produces garbage. Using `Windows-1252` properly decodes the content. See  [tiptoi® Manager.lnk.zip](https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/files/8103701/tiptoi.Manager.lnk.zip) for the exact content of the .lnk file.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2022.2.14-trento

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new bottle of type Application or Gaming
2. Click on 'Run .exe/.msi in this bottle' and select the [tiptoi_Manager_Installer.exe](https://www.ravensburger.de/db/Installer/tiptoi_Manager_Installer.exe) and complete the installation process
2a. Alternative to the full installation it is enough to copy the .lnk file from [tiptoi® Manager.lnk.zip](https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/files/8103701/tiptoi.Manager.lnk.zip) to `drive_c/ProgramData/Microsoft/Windows/Start Menu/Programs`in a bottle.
3. Click on the bottle to open it
4. Nothing happens and the above mentioned error occures in the console where bottles was launched

**Expected behavior**
The bottle keeps working as it did before the installation.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: NixOS
 - Version 22.05
 - Display server: Xorg
**Additional context**
The issue occures in both flatpak and nixos native installation.

title: not run on ubuntu 20.04
body:
Please don't fill issue for a Windows executable that doesn't work in Bottles. Our software is a Wine prefix manager. If a Windows application doesn't work, it could be a Wine problem (**Wine is NOT a software developed by Bottles**) or a misconfiguration of the wineprefix (take a look at WineHQ: https://www.winehq.org) or ProtonDB: https://www.protondb.com for more information on the software you are trying to run). 

We will support the installation of Windows software, only through our official installers: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/55 (when these are ready).
Please DO NOT open issues for this reason. Issues should be used to report Bugs and request New Features for Bottles.

**Describe the bug**

title: [BUG] Bottle path problems after re-naming existing bottle
body:
**Describe the bug**
Bottles doesn't respect paths after re-naming existing bottle. I removed my AUR version and installed Flatpak version, give permission to Bottles for folders where i'm keeping my bottles. I just renamed my bottle from LauncherSet to Launchers in Bottles UI. When i use "Browse" button in Details & Utilities, it sends me to "/run/user/1000/doc/5cec2296/Bottles/LauncherSet/" but i'm keeping my bottles in "/home/dhiz/Games/Bottles". 

I tried to find what is wrong with it and i used text editor for "bottle.yml" file in bottle directory. It shows "/home/dhiz/Games/LauncherSet" everywhere, every path where it needs, but as i said i changed its name to Launchers. When i look to my bottle directory, the path is "/home/dhiz/Games/Launchers" but bottle.yaml still uses LauncherSet. I changed every name in it by hand, now it sends me to correct directory. Before i changed it to correct name i can't open some *.exe files even path is correct(tried to test it in terminal, shows correct path but still can't find where it is).

_Now i have another problems, of course... I blame Flatpak for this but i need to test it. The problem is, Cloud save isn't work on Epic Games Launcher and i think it isn't work on Ubisoft Connect too(it isn't gave any error but i don't get my save files). Before Flatpak version i didn't have this problem. Maybe this problem is came from Bottles or Flatpak, maybe from my OS, maybe from Launchers... I really don't know it, i didn't use Flatpak before. But i'm still adding this problem to this Issue, maybe your eyes just catch something about it in somewhere if it is from your side._

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2022.2.14-trento

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Remove AUR(or maybe another package repository except Flatpak, i suppose) version of Bottles

5. Change your bottle name in Bottles UI

**Describe the bug**
After update the Pekka Kana 2 game doesn't launch. It just displays error "Could not find the default language file". Tried caffe-7.0, caffe 6.23-x86_64 and Proton-6.21-GE-2 but they all throw the same error.

**Expected behavior**
Pekka Kana 2 launching and being able to play it. It had a small bug with mouse click crashing the game but the mouse isn't needed there anyway.

**Additional context**
Everything default - both Bottles and my OS. The update that broke it must have been released sometime before the February because I tried reinstalling the game so I have copied the save data (from PK2) and it shows: "modified: 28th January" "created 26th January"

title: [BUG] Naming bottles a certain way such as "yes".
body:
# Ignore as this is a non-issue it turns out

**Describe the bug**
Bottle names can be a bit finicky, maybe add quotes?
Bottle name from the .yml seen as boolean value thus can not be seen by Bottles app. then changed bottle name manually from .yml, it is recognized again.
Bottle path from the .yml seen as a boolean value thus creating a different prefix from the one wanted when run (the prefix first created is "yes", and then upon running executable, it created a prefix in a new folder "True".
putting quotes around "yes" in the bottle.yml file seems to fix it since it now seen as a string by python instead of a boolean

**Installation**
 - Method: AUR
 - Version: 2022.1.28

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Bottles
2. Create a Bottle with a name that may be taken as a boolean value by python
3. Succesfully create a bottle
4. Run something in said bottle

**Expected behavior**
For bottle/prefix to be recognized by Bottles app and for bottles to use the correct path.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch, GNOME
 - Version 40
 - Display server: Wayland

title: [BUG] Scrivener License Activation fails with default 'Software' Bottle incl. workaround
body:
**Describe the bug**
Scrivener, the software, works fine in Bottles/Wine, however the activation component presents issues. 

When Scrivener is installed using the 'Software' template, I was unable to get the activation manager to work correctly (uses a tool called Paddle that talks out to a license server,) however, with a custom bottle I was able to enter my license and get the appropriate response from the server.

Basically, the "bug" is that I had to use a custom bottle, install Scrivener, then install dotnet462 before I could activate the license. 

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak & Fedora RPM
 - Version: 2022.1.28-trento-4 (Flatpak)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install Scrivener in a Software bottle.
2. Attempt to activate license.
3. Watch it get stuck in a loop.
4. Play around with .net installs for a while. 
5. Eventually reinstall in a "Custom" bottle and install dotnet462.
6. Activate license successfully.

**Expected behavior**
The Software bottle should allow activation of the license, I'm not sure what combination of factors makes it fail in this case.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version 34
 - Display server: Wayland (fallback to Xwayland for legacy apps)

**Additional context**
N/A

title: [BUG] Bottles freeze the entire system on Ubuntu 18.04 (hwe 5.4.0-97-generic)

labels.name: Can't replicate
labels.description: It's not possible to replicate the issue

body:
Please don't fill issue for a Windows executable that doesn't work in Bottles. Our software is a Wine prefix manager. If a Windows application doesn't work, it could be a Wine problem (**Wine is NOT a software developed by Bottles**) or a misconfiguration of the wineprefix (take a look at WineHQ: https://www.winehq.org) or ProtonDB: https://www.protondb.com for more information on the software you are trying to run). 

We will support the installation of Windows software, only through our official installers: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/55 (when these are ready).
Please DO NOT open issues for this reason. Issues should be used to report Bugs and request New Features for Bottles.

**Describe the bug**
When I try to run an exe in Bottles it starts to use 100% CPU and the system freezes. There is no way to run e.g. ctrl+alt+F1. The only way to "unfreeze" the system is to use the power button. This leads to broken file system. Then I need to run fsck from the Ubuntu recovery (initramfs). I managed to start the the exe once after several fsck but on the second run it freeze again. The very same exe files run OK under wine and POL. This laptop is my work laptop and there not much software installed. On my other laptop with tons of software (same bottles config) and ubuntu 20.04 there are no such issues. I tested both laptops with the default configs for games and for software. The results are the same. Did't try with custom configs.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2022.1.28-trento-3

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Just run any .exe file
2. Wait 5 seconds and the system will freeze (the exe is not started, at least there is no GUI)

**Expected behavior**
I expect the exe file to start.
**Screenshots**
Not possible to take screenshot

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04 with HWE (kernel 5.4.0-97-generic)
 - Version 18:04
 - Display server: Xorg
**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: [BUG] Bottles flatpak does not download dxvk-nvapi
body:
**Describe the bug**
Looks like flatpak version trento-3 does not download dxvknvapi.

**Installation**
 - Method: [e.g. Appimage, Meson build, other]
 - Version [e.g. 2021.7.2 (find this in the about dialog)]

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
0130:err:winediag:ntlm_check_version ntlm_auth was not found or is outdated. Make sure that ntlm_auth >= 3.0.25 is in your path. Usually, you can find it in the winbind package of your distribution.
```

ntlm_auth is present in my system...

title: [BUG] Changing the DXVK version results in the backup .bck files getting removed, which then makes it impossible to deactivate DXVK without breaking the prefix.
body:
**Description & Steps To Reproduce**
* Create a new Wine prefix via Bottles.
* Enable DXVK, either manually or automatically (via choosing the "Gaming" type for the prefix).
* Observe how there is a d3d*.dll.bck file for every d3d*.dll file replaced by DXVK in system32 and syswow64.
* Go to the prefix's preferences and change the DXVK version.
* Observe how the .bck files get deleted.
* Go to the prefix's preferences and disable DXVK completely.
* Observe how there are now no d3d*.dll files at all to be found in system32/syswow64, because the .dll files got removed but there were not .bck backups to be restored in their place.
* The prefix is now broken.

**Expected behavior**
The .bck files should remain untouched and always available to be restored whenever DXVK is disabled.

**Installation**
Method: AUR
Version: 2022.1.28-trento

**Additional context**
The terminal output does not give me any useful hints as to what could be responsible behind the scenes.

title: [BUG] Occasionally Bottles starts up slow/delayed which causes a distorted "blank" Bottles application window to appear until it loads
body:
Flatpak 2022.1.14-trento-4
Operating System: Arch Linux
KDE Plasma Version: 5.23.5
KDE Frameworks Version: 5.90.0
Qt Version: 5.15.2
Kernel Version: 5.15.16-hardened1-1-hardened (64-bit)
Graphics Platform: X11

I don't like to put in tickets like this because it is not easy to reproduce and I don't even have steps to reproduce but I figured I would make one and see if anyone else has any ideas or experiences.

What happens in occasionally when I launch Bottles it takes 5-7 seconds to load. During this time a blank "Bottles" appears with just that outline that appears on my screen. This causes a visual glitch until Bottles fully loads.

I am not sure what is causing this as my computer is very powerful and the SSD is fast. My internet connection is great as well. **If I had to guess, Bottles is encountering some kind of error it is trying to self-correct before it loads. Or trying to check for dependency/news updates via Internet and is waiting for a response from the servers.**

The only error I see when launching via terminal is:
```
Failed to load module "canberra-gtk-module"
```
I know it is not this causing the delay because even when that one shows up, Bottles loads instantly.

I'm hoping other users can provide experiences or thoughts because although this is a very minor issue, it is jarring when it happens because it loads at the front of other applications and creates a blank void unless you click in the Plasma task manager to minimize it.

I use Bottles pretty much all day off and on opening and closing and I would say it happens at least 1 or 2 times a day.

After I am done playing a game (Final Fantasy VII Remastered) a WINE has crashed error pops up with the following

title: [BUG] Can't Find d3d12.dll when Creating New 'Application' Bottle - Throws "File or Directory Doesn't Exist" Exception
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to create a new bottle, the app throws an exception while installing VKD3D. When running from the console, the app throws a "No such file or directory" exception after failing to find `/home/cachandler/.local/share/bottles/vkd3d/vkd3d-v2.4/x86/d3d12.dll`.

**Installation**
 - Method: AUR
 - Version 2022.1.14-trento-4

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Bottles
2. Click on "New Bottle"
3. Add a name and choose the "Application" preset.
4. Try to create the bottle.

**Expected behavior**
The bottle would be created successfully, and would not look for a nonexistent dll file.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70250943/150266634-78178954-c5f4-423e-95ca-cbe549576389.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Manjaro Linux
 - Display server: Xorg

**Logs**
```
(19:15:33) INFO Installing VKD3D… 
(19:15:33) ERROR Error while running async job: <bound method Manager.create_bottle of <bottles.backend.manager.Manager object at 0x7facbdbf4e20>>
Exception: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/cachandler/.local/share/bottles/vkd3d/vkd3d-v2.4/x86/d3d12.dll' 
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/utils.py", line 339, in __target
    result = self.task_func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/manager.py", line 1206, in create_bottle
    self.install_dll_component(config, "vkd3d", version=vkd3d_name)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/manager.py", line 1394, in install_dll_component
    manager.install(config, exclude)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dll.py", line 35, in install
    self.__install_dll(config, path, dll)
  File "/usr/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dll.py", line 66, in __install_dll
    shutil.copyfile(source, target)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/shutil.py", line 254, in copyfile
    with open(src, 'rb') as fsrc:
```

**Additional context**
When I checked `/home/cachandler/.local/share/bottles/vkd3d/vkd3d-v2.4/x86/d3d12.dll` to see if the file existed, I found that it did not. However, `/home/cachandler/.local/share/bottles/vkd3d/vkd3d-v2.4/x32/d3d12.dll` did exist. While I may be mistaken, this seems to indicate that Bottles is mistakenly checking a nonexistent "x86" folder for the dll file, when it should be looking for a "x32" folder.

title: [BUG] NVAPI64.dll not registered (Bottles is using Wine-Staging NVAPI instead of DXVK-NVAPI)
body:
**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2022.1.14-trento-4

**Describe the bug**
Bottles is not loading or installing DXVK-NVAPI properly. It's instead loading Wine-Staging's built-in NVAPI.

Details with evidence that the Wine-Staging NVAPI is being loaded:
https://github.com/jp7677/dxvk-nvapi/issues/67

Could it be related to caffe being based on wine-tkg which contains wine-staging code and therefore having NVAPI built in? There may be some additional step required to force us to load DXVK-NVAPI properly. Maybe some "load native DLL first, never load built-in" setting is missing for this to work.

Edit: Yes, it's caused by Wine-TKG's built-in fake NVAPI DLL. It's being loaded instead of DXVK-NVAPI DLL.

body:
**Describe the bug**
If a program's path contains an apostrophe/single quote in its path, then launching it breaks with:

```
(11:56:45) INFO Running an executable on the bottle… 
/bin/sh: -c: line 1: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `''
/bin/sh: -c: line 2: syntax error: unexpected end of file
```

Removing the apostrophe restores functionality.

**To Reproduce**

1. Add a game which contains an apostrophe in its path or .exe name, like e.g. Baldur's Gate.
2. Try to launch it.
3. Fail and see error.

When a new program is added to the Programs list, trying to rename it results in the whole list of programs disappearing. Upon Bottles restart the list is back and the new program appears correctly renamed. Meanwhile, trying to add a new program after the list has disappeared and before Bottles is restarted results in the following error:

title: [BUG] Net Framework 3.5 does not install
body:
**Describe the bug**
Net Framework applications at least on Net 3.5 don't seem to work, probably also on other versions. 

**Installation**
 - Method: flatpak (AppImage doesn't come that far)
 - Version 2022.1.14-trento-2

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create new bottle
2. (do nothing or install .Net 3.5/4.0/4.5... or install mono or install everything)
3. Install your .Net Framework application (i.e. DAoC Portal)
4. Start that application
5. See error

**Expected behavior**
Application stops right after starting it. Terminal shows error message:
```
00fc:err:module:fixup_imports_ilonly mscoree.dll not found, IL-only binary L"Portal.exe" cannot be loaded
00fc:err:module:LdrInitializeThunk Importing dlls for L"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\DAoC Portal\\Portal.exe" failed, status c0000135
```

 - Display server: X11
 
**Additional context**

The same application in a previous bottle worked a month ago and stopped working (in the same bottle). The new bottle is of course only created for troubleshooting.

title: [BUG] Bottles doesn't detect GPU if reported as '3D Controller'
body:
**Describe the bug**
```
❯ lspci | grep 'VGA\|3D'
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation UHD Graphics 620 (rev 07)
01:00.0 3D controller: NVIDIA Corporation GP107M [GeForce GTX 1050 Mobile] (rev a1)
```
NVIDIA GPU isn't detected by bottles if lspci reports it as a '3D controller'.
Therefore the NVIDIA GPU is not used by games.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2022.1.14-trento-2

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Bottles
2. Click on 'Health check'
3. NVIDIA GPU is not listed
4. Health check output:
```
Display:
    X.org: true
    X.org (port): :99.0
    Wayland: true
Graphics:
    vendors:
        intel:
            vendor: intel
            envs:
                DRI_PRIME: '1'
            icd: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/GL/vulkan/icd.d/intel_icd.x86_64.json:/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/GL/vulkan/icd.d/intel_icd.i686.json
    prime:
        integrated: null
        discrete: null
Kernel:
    Type: Linux
    Version: 5.15.13-200.fc35.x86_64
Distro:
    Name: GNOME
    Version: '"41 (Flatpak runtime)"'
Tools:
    cabextract: true
    p7zip: true
    patool: true
Bottles_envs: null
```

**Expected behavior**
Detect NVIDIA GPUs even if lspci output is '3D controller'.

**Laptop:**
 - OS: Fedora Silverblue
 - Version 35
 - Display server: Wayland

**Solution**
My workaround was to change 'VGA' to '3D' in these lines:
https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/blob/d8abb6b225f06c64b1e2b6adac43a9949e09636b/src/backend/gpu.py#L46
https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/blob/d8abb6b225f06c64b1e2b6adac43a9949e09636b/src/backend/display.py#L35
<details><summary>Health check output:</summary>

```
Display:
    X.org: true
    X.org (port): :99.0
    Wayland: true
Graphics:
    vendors:
        nvidia: &id002
            vendor: nvidia
            envs:
                __NV_PRIME_RENDER_OFFLOAD: '1'
                __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME: nvidia
                __VK_LAYER_NV_optimus: NVIDIA_only
            icd: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/GL/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_icd.json:/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu/GL/vulkan/icd.d/nvidia_icd.json
        intel: &id001
```

title: [BUG] Exe is launched every single time you go into a bottle, then it closes itself
body:
2022.1.14-trento flatpak
In the latest version everytime you go into a bottle, it will launch an .exe and close it right away. For some instances this is unjarring because it makes the screen black for a couple seconds before closing.

I think it is a bug in the new feature to "stop" an exe from the main screen because you can see the "Play" button change to "Stop" button for a second and back to "Play" again all without any interaction from the user. Every single time you go into a bottle.

When you have the console/logs window open, you can clearly see it is launching the exe, but it should not be because Bottles was not asked too yet.

title: [BUG] Bottles synchronously opens network connections right after launch
body:
### Problem:

Network connections can be slow and unreliable, and trying to 
synchronously open connections to fetch components list, dependencies list, installers index etc. makes opening Bottles very slow, and in some cases outright impossible. IMO expecting the user's internet connection to be reliable is very bad practice and should NEVER be done anywhere.

### Solution:

Fetching components list, dependencies list, installers index etc. 
should either be done asynchronously after launch, or better yet, they should be fetched right when they're needed.

##### Info

Version:  2022.1.14-trento-1

title: [BUG] ensure wineserver is down before change sync type
body:
**Describe the bug**
Ref: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/programs/issues/17

On sync change (esync fsync sys) if the bottle wineserver is up, next commands will fail. This is because the wineserver was spawned with a different sync. 

**Installation**
 - Method: any
 - Version: any

**Fix**
On sync change, force kill all running processes (the user should be notified).

For example, if I make Bottles the entire screen and close Bottles, when I open it again it will be the same size even though I made it full screen when I closed it.
