title: [BUG] Xwayland not accessible from inside the sandbox
body:
**Describe the bug**
Bottles fails to get the Xwayland display. It looks like XAUTHORITY is not being correctly propagated to inside the flatpak sandbox, see below.

~Potentially related: #623 and #794~ Actually no, had thought this before discovering the XAUTHORITY issue.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2021.12.28-treviso

**To Reproduce**
1. Be on Wayland
2. Create a bottle
3. Attempt to open anything (winecfg, command line, ...)

**Expected behavior**
- XAUTHORITY should be available inside the sandbox
- A window should open
- On error, it would be nice to have a popup

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Display server: Wayland, Plasma 5.23.4

**Additional context**

Logs from the error:

```
(11:06:08) INFO Setting Key: [sync] to [esync] for bottle: [MyBottle]… 
(11:06:08) INFO Setting Key: [discrete_gpu] to [True] for bottle: [MyBottle]… 
(11:06:08) INFO Setting Key: [pulseaudio_latency] to [True] for bottle: [MyBottle]… 
(11:06:08) ERROR Cannot find states.yml file for bottle: [MyBottle] 

(bottles:2): Handy-CRITICAL **: 11:06:08.812: hdy_stackable_box_set_visible_child_name: assertion 'contains_child' failed
(11:06:09) INFO Running winecfg on the wineprefix… 
(11:06:09) INFO Using Xwayland.. 
(11:06:09) ERROR Failed to get Xwayland display 
```

Running some checks inside the flatpak sandbox:

```bash
flatpak run --command=sh --devel com.usebottles.bottles
%1~$ echo $DISPLAY

%1~$ xdpyinfo -display :0
Authorization required, but no authorization protocol specified
xdpyinfo:  unable to open display ":0".
%1~$ xdpyinfo -display :1
xdpyinfo:  unable to open display ":1".
%1~$ 
```

This fixes the problem:

```bash
$ echo "$XAUTHORITY"
/run/user/1900/xauth_bruVGd
$ cp "$XAUTHORITY" ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/xauth

title: [BUG] Bottles gaming profile create a wineprefix which programs can't find D3DCOMPILER_43.dll
body:
**Describe the bug**
The gaming profile installs by default the d3dcompiler_43 setting up native,builtin dll override. This produces errors where the program can find the dll in the prefix. Creating a clean prefix using wine directly, doesn't produce this issue.

**Installation**
 - Method: debian package
 - Version 2021.12.14-treviso-3

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a gaming bottle
2. Add vcredist2019
3. Run hotwheels.exe (this is from epicgames)
4. Program doesn't start
5. Running from the command line shows the following error:

    ```
    01b4:err:module:import_dll Loading library D3DCOMPILER_43.dll (which is needed by L"Z:\\mnt\\games\\legendary\\HOTWHEELSUNLEASHED\\hotwheels\\Binaries\\Win64\\EpicGamesStore\\hotwheels-Win64-Shipping.exe") failed (error c000007b).
    01b4:err:module:LdrInitializeThunk Importing dlls for **L"Z:\\mnt\\games\\legendary\\HOTWHEELSUNLEASHED\\hotwheels\\Binaries\\Win64\\EpicGamesStore\\hotwheels-Win64-Shipping.exe"** failed, status c0000135
    01ac:fixme:kernelbase:AppPolicyGetProcessTerminationMethod FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFA, 0000000000B9FD70
    ```

**Expected behavior**
It should be able to find the library and go its merry way.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian
 - Version Testing
 - Display server: xorg

**Additional context**
While I understand the rationale to installing dx libraries by default, it seems that I would need to use custom to make sure that this doesn't happen. Also, I'm unable to remove it, which seems counter-intuitive.

title: [BUG] New Rename feature isn't working as intended
body:
Flatpak 2021.12.28-treviso

I tried the new feature of renaming an .exe and instead of renaming the one in the programs list, it added a new one with the new name (it works) but also kept the old one.

I then tried to remove the old one with the old name from the "Programs" tab and instead it removed both of them until I hit refresh and then only the old one is there.

I would have thought by renaming it would actually rename the current one and not just clone/make a new one. In which case there should be a command that automatically runs to remove the old one instead of making the user do it manually. Currently it is more like "clone+rename" instead of "rename"

But if you still need the old one to make the new named one to work, then it should clone+hide it automatically.

Screenshots

Renamed from the Details & Utilities tab:
![20211229-162718](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93590337/147705151-a504d5d2-3bfe-47a2-b885-75d22143a519.png)

Went to Programs tab to remove the old one
![20211229-162911](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93590337/147705163-19599c8e-c15d-44e1-a2f0-653c4c9e0426.png)

Both are removed
![20211229-163327](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93590337/147705172-81f21c7a-4e53-45cd-88d2-7236ed9c3a1a.png)

Hit refresh and only the old one remains. New one is gone
![20211229-163331](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93590337/147705180-2482b263-cda7-4383-8018-1934b67d2fa1.png)

title: [BUG] Cannot manipulate the LDT on Flatpak
body:
When trying to run [some random old program](https://clic.xtec.cat/legacy/en/clic3/download.htm) with Bottles under Flatpak, the following error pops up:

```
modify_ldt: Operation not permitted
wine: Unhandled page fault on read access to 000002F8 at address 7E267241 (thread 010c), starting debugger...

The culprit might be Flatpak not allowing manipulation of LDT entries, and seems to align with a ticket over at Lutris: https://github.com/flathub/net.lutris.Lutris/issues/85

title: [Request] Enter in a text input should submit/continue the view
body:
When naming a new bottle, enter doesn't do anything in the box. One would expect that it should submit the form in the state it's is. This happens on the following text input:

- Versioning naming
- Renaming bottle
- Changing launch options of a program
- Program environment variable
- Creating a bottle

Those are the only ones I've found. I've also found that enter and space are ignored in buttons, but [that's another bug report.](https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/861)

title: [BUG] Enter/space on a button doesn't do anything, only clicks work
body:
Buttons like "new bottle", "Cancel"/"Save" in dialog boxes ignore keyboard enter/space, but it works with on/off toggles, submenus (like notifications, preferences), dropdowns (like FSR option, virtual desktop size).

Buttons should be aware of keyboard input and be consistent with the rest.

title: [BUG] On fresh install, exits at the install step with no indication of reason
body:
Please don't fill issue for a Windows executable that doesn't work in Bottles. Our software is a Wine prefix manager. If a Windows application doesn't work, it could be a Wine problem (**Wine is NOT a software developed by Bottles**) or a misconfiguration of the wineprefix (take a look at WineHQ: https://www.winehq.org) or ProtonDB: https://www.protondb.com for more information on the software you are trying to run). 

We will support the installation of Windows software, only through our official installers: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/55 (when these are ready).
Please DO NOT open issues for this reason. Issues should be used to report Bugs and request New Features for Bottles.

**Describe the bug**
On a fresh install, and first start, Bottles just exits when it gets to the step to install the runners, and doesn't install any runners.

**Installation**

  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/utils.py", line 181, in info
    self.root.info(self.__color("info", message))
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/utils.py", line 160, in __color
    if "\n" in message:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/views/new.py", line 238, in finish
    self.new_bottle_config = result.data.get("config")
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'data'
```

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2021.12.14-treviso-3

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install Bottles
2. Open Bottles and install runners
3. Create bottle

or

1. Remove Bottles directory `rm -rf ~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles`
2. Open Bottles and install runners
3. Create bottle

**Expected behavior**
Successfully creating a bottle

**Screenshots**
It stopped at Setting Windows version
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39202026/146259343-1994169d-5e2d-4475-ad11-9acbd116f135.png)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version: 35
 - Display server: Wayland

title: [BUG] Wine can't open windows on wayland
body:
**Describe the bug**
Wine can't open any windows on wayland. Works fine on Xorg. Similar bug to #623 

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2021.12.14-treviso-2

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Try to open anything in a bottle in wayland
2. See error in terminal
3. No windows show up

**Expected behavior**
Wine windows should open in wayland

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora Silverblue
 - Version 35
 - Display server: Wayland
**Additional context**
Logs: 
https://gist.github.com/Voleil/94f7dcbf7b2cac9b9ed8bd063389614c

title: [BUG] Crash during initial download
body:
**Describe the bug**
I installed Bottles, started it, and in the initial setup wizard, I confirmed the initial download. Immediately once the dialog switches to "Downloading...", the whole program crashes. This happens every time I try it, i.e. I can't start and use Bottles at all.

In the terminal I see this:

body:
**Describe the bug**
Problem with some dependencies on 32-bit bottle. Failed to install, then locks up the dependency tab.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version [2021.11.28-treviso][latest commit as of 2021-12-07]

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a 32-bit bottle.
2. Try to install msxml6.

```
2021-12-10 23:35:17 INFO: Installing dependency [msxml6] in bottle [gamejp].
Downloading msxml6-KB973686-enu-amd64.exe: 100% [==================================================>

Exception: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/fenglengshun/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/a/drive_c/windows/syswow64//msxml6.dll'
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/utils.py", line 318, in __target
result = self.task_func(*args, **kwargs)
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 163, in install
res = self.__perform_steps(config, step)
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 256, in __perform_steps
if not self.__step_get_from_cab(config=config, step=step):
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 517, in __step_get_from_cab
shutil.copy(
File "/usr/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 426, in copy
copyfile(src, dst, follow_symlinks=follow_symlinks)
File "/usr/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 265, in copyfile
with open(src, 'rb') as fsrc, open(dst, 'wb') as fdst:
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/widgets/dependency.py", line 159, in set_install_status
if result.status:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'status'
```

Was able to replicate even after resetting all flatpak overrides and deleting bottle's ~/.var/app folder.

**Expected behavior**
msxml6 exits with no issues.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26621899/145615101-280e3fa7-479a-49ff-a660-909de5791393.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
- OS: Garuda Linux
- Kernel: 5.15.7-zen1-1-zen
- Uptime: 17 hours, 37 mins
- Packages: 1814 (pacman), 62 (flatpak)
- Shell: zsh
- DE: Plasma 5.23.4
- WM: KWin
- Terminal: konsole
- CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 3400G (8) @ 3.7GHz
- GPU: AMD ATI Radeon RX 570
- Memory: 12.54GiB / 31.34GiB

**Additional context**
msxml6 installs just fine on 64-bit bottle. I looked in the c:/windows/system32 folder, and found that msxml.dll to msxml6r.dll is present, even without installing the dependency. To check some things, I also tried with mf.dll, and it seems to be the same - dependency installer locks up, error message in console, but mf*.dlls are already present in system32.

```
Downloading windows6.1-kb976932-x64_74865ef2562006e51d7f9333b4a8d45b7a749dab.exe: 100% [==================================================>

2021-12-10 22:33:30 INFO: Renaming [windows6.1-kb976932-x64_74865ef2562006e51d7f9333b4a8d45b7a749dab.exe] to [windows6.1-kb976932-x64.exe].
2021-12-10 22:33:31 INFO: Setting Key: [State] to [0] for bottle: [Game32]…
2021-12-10 22:33:31 INFO: Setting Key: [Versioning] to [True] for bottle: [Game32]…
2021-12-10 22:33:31 INFO: New state [0] created successfully!
2021-12-10 22:33:31 INFO: Bottles found: GameJP|Game32
2021-12-10 22:33:31 INFO: [Game32] is now bottled.
wine: configuration in L"/home/fenglengshun/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/Game32" has been updated.
2021-12-10 22:33:32 INFO: Bottles found: GameJP|Game32
2021-12-10 22:33:34 ERROR: Error while running async job: <bound method DependencyManager.install of <bottles.backend.dependency.DependencyManager object at 0x7f0ffa6a5bb0>>
Exception: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/home/fenglengshun/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/GameJP/drive_c/windows/syswow64//mf.dll'
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/utils.py", line 318, in __target
result = self.task_func(*args, **kwargs)
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 163, in install
res = self.__perform_steps(config, step)
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 256, in __perform_steps
if not self.__step_get_from_cab(config=config, step=step):
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/backend/dependency.py", line 517, in __step_get_from_cab
shutil.copy(
File "/usr/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 426, in copy
copyfile(src, dst, follow_symlinks=follow_symlinks)
File "/usr/lib/python3.9/shutil.py", line 265, in copyfile
with open(src, 'rb') as fsrc, open(dst, 'wb') as fdst:
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/widgets/dependency.py", line 159, in set_install_status
if result.status:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'status'
006c:err:rpc:RpcAssoc_BindConnection syntax {57c680ac-7bce-4f39-97fd-ffea566754d5}, 0.0 not supported
```

Judging by the error message, the file the dependency installer downloaded, and looking at c:/windows, it seems that the dependency installer pulled the 64-bit msxml6 installer, tried to install it, but can't because it's not a 64-bit windows prefix.

I also checked on dotnet35, just in case. That one seems to register just fine, even though it exits with an error message:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26621899/145617910-3a9baabe-6eb9-4d35-8707-46eac6c945ac.png)

Clicked close.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26621899/145617985-7c59f5fb-3129-4449-9198-0d6e77e20f16.png)


It seems that there are already a number of 32-bit dependencies installed by default, so perhaps a message notifying that "On a 32-bit bottle, this is already intstalled," or disabling unneeded dependencies install if bottles entered a 32-bit bottle? Or maybe it's an issue with grabbing wrong installer or script?

title: [BUG] Renaming a bottle does not change the directory name which then creates conflicts and doesn't delete the correct bottle
body:
I had made a forum question for this, but after testing for a while I am encountering bugs. https://forums.usebottles.com/d/24-is-this-working-as-designed-renaming-bottles

When a user makes a bottle named for example ABC then renames it to ABCDEF, The name is only changed on the Bottles frontend and the directory is still "ABC". If the user then makes another ABC bottle, since ABC is now being used by ABCDEF it makes ABC_### (3 random numbers so there is no conflict). However when you then go to delete the ABC bottle, Bottles gets confused and deleted the wrong bottle!

1) Create a bottle named ABC
2) Rename it to ABCDEF
-> the directory for ABCDEF is still the original ABC
3) Create a new bottle named ABC
4) It creates a bottle directory named ABC_### (3 random numbers because the now ABCDEF is still using ABC)
5) Close bottles and reopen it
6) Attempt to delete the ABC bottle and it will delete the ABCDEF bottle because it is using that ones name in the frontend/backend but it should have deleted ABC_###
-> It creates a new bottle with undefined features because of a conflict.

Ideally when renaming a bottle in Bottles, it would change the directory in the backend as well to avoid all of this conflict.

title: [Request] Multiple directories where bottles can be stored & read from
body:
Currently if a user wants to have bottles in multiple locations, they need to export and then import the bottle when needed. My proposition is Bottles being able to read bottles from multiple directories. This may be an issue for flatpak users like myself, but it should be solvable by simply adding a direct path in "Filesystems>Other Files" in flatseal. A simple guide would solve that.

Basically, the functionality would mimic Steam where you can have libraries on multiple drives.

Currently for Bottles, the default is
/home/XXXXXXXX/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/

with this new functionality we could for example add
/run/media/XXXXXXX/XXXXX/bottles/
/home/XXXXXX/Documents/bottles/
etc

Let me know if you require a better description/examples.

If this does get implemented, there will need to be safety checks put into place to avoid a different bug I am encountering in [767.](https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/767)

title: [BUG] I can' t remove a bottle that has already been created
body:
Please don't fill issue for a Windows executable that doesn't work in Bottles. Our software is a Wine prefix manager. If a Windows application doesn't work, it could be a Wine problem (**Wine is NOT a software developed by Bottles**) or a misconfiguration of the wineprefix (take a look at WineHQ: https://www.winehq.org) or ProtonDB: https://www.protondb.com for more information on the software you are trying to run). 

We will support the installation of Windows software, only through our official installers: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/55 (when these are ready).
Please DO NOT open issues for this reason. Issues should be used to report Bugs and request New Features for Bottles.

**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**Installation**
Flatpak bottles


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
kubuntu 20.04
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Dependency search by description/full name.
body:
Flatpak 2021.11.28-treviso

I'm not sure if this is a bug or feature request. But I will put it in as a bug first because I am leaning towards that by the text.

When a user is in a Bottle and then the "Dependencies" tab, the search bar at the top shows you can search by "Microsoft .NET Framework 4 ..". However that search bar only actually shows results for the dependency name and not the description/full name.

For example, if you type in "Microsoft" there are no results. If you type in "dotnet" you will see the various dependencies that start with "dotnet".

Judging by the search bar text I am guessing this is a bug, however it could just be an oversight in which case it would be a request.

The bug/feature request:

Allow searching by both dependency name and/or description/full name.

title: [BUG] Duplicating a bottle creates a bottle much larger than the original
body:
**Describe the bug**
In `~/.var/app/com.usebottles.bottles/data/bottles/bottles/my-bottle/drive_c/users/me/AppData/Roaming/Microsoft/Windows/` exists a file called `Templates` that points to home directory. This file causes duplicating a bottle to create one much larger than the original.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2021.11.14-treviso-4

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a new Software bottle
2. Click on 'Duplicate bottle'
3. Despite the original bottle being ~450MB, new bottle is tens of GB in size (I stopped it at 30GB, but it would've kept going).

**Expected behavior**
Duplicate bottle should be identical in size to the original bottle.

title: [BUG] Experimental Installer uses wrong checksum for EpicInstaller-13.0.0.msi
body:
**Describe the bug**
Using the experimental install feature, Epic Game Store can not be downloaded due to wrong checksum. Issue has been present on previous versions of Bottles such as 2021.9.28-treviso.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2021.10.14-treviso-1

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create new bottle based on a runner of your choice
2. Go to Installers
3. Click on the "Install Epic Game Store" button
4. After installation, Epic Game Store does not appear, though dependencies were installed, also no Epic folder in Program Files or Program Files (x86)

**Expected behavior**
Should install Epic Game Store and add to the Programs list, however, fails to download to the wrong checksum.

**Potential solution:**
Change md5sum in manifest to the current correct value: "ebde67191bc1a483fd821daf8e01ce46"

**Screenshots**

![Bildschirmfoto von 2021-10-14 21-19-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79299376/137382005-c7cbd435-10cd-40ee-8459-a5c60f3d8670.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora Silverblue
 - Version 35

**Additional context**
Installing the .msi directly works as one would expect and the experience is great.

title: [BUG] Ubisoft Connect API Error
body:
**Describe the bug**
Same issue as mentioned here: https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/562#issuecomment-926363763
After installing Ubisoft Connect, both via UbisoftConnectInstaller.exe or the experimental Installer feature, the application cannot be started, showcasing an API error (Error at hooking API "LdrFindResource_U"). This error does not happen when using Proton via the "Add a non Steam Game" function inside Steam, nor has it happened on 2021.9.28-treviso.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 2021.10.14-treviso-1

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create new bottle based on a runner of your choice
2. Go to Installers (or install UbisoftConnetInstaller.exe diretly)
3. Click on the "Install Uplay" button
4. Try starting Uplay after installation has finished
5. Error

**Expected behavior**
Ubisoft Connect should be able to launch as expected and as seen when installing it via Steams "Add a non Steam Game" function or previous versions of Bottles such as 2021.9.28-treviso.

**Screenshots**
![Bildschirmfoto von 2021-10-14 19-16-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79299376/137374275-d9bb8b5e-b80d-4dd2-99cf-9423eb9a566f.png)

![Bildschirmfoto von 2021-10-14 20-29-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79299376/137375346-200577d7-0cf9-44f2-afb3-37c71a2dc752.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora Silverblue
 - Version 35

**Additional context**
Of note is that the issue was found by another user on 2021.9.14-treviso, yet was not present on 2021.9.28-treviso. I was able to install and launch Ubisoft Connect via the experimental Installer feature on release 2021.9.28-treviso, where all core features of Ubisoft Connect worked as expected.

Despite the manifest not being changed between versions, I tried manually adding both different versions of dotnet and vcredists via the dependency tab, though that did not make a difference. The same goes for trying a few launch options.

Furthermore, the error is reproducible on other runners such as lutris-6.14-4 and Proton-6.19-GE-2 when using Bottles.

title: [BUG] Wrong working directory for external programs
body:
**Describe the bug**
The wrong (or none at all) working directory is set for external programs.

**Installation**
 - Method: aur
 - Version 2021.8.14-1

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add an external program which relies on the current working directory
2. Try to start the program and see it crashing or misbehaving
3. Try to open the program folder from the programs context menu and see nothing happen:
    ~~~
    gio: file:///home/lucki/Game.exe: Fehler beim Holen der Informationen für Datei »/home/lucki/Game.exe«: Datei oder Verzeichnis nicht gefunden
    gio: file:///home/lucki/Game.exe: Error getting information for file »/home/lucki/Game.exe«: file or folder not found
    ~~~

**Expected behavior**
The correct working directory has been set either automatically to the executable path or through an option.

**Screenshots**

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch

**Additional context**
This looks like the causing line:
https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/blob/97d409a4b954ac6ae5a6bb86f4d9ba18d5b6c31a/src/runner.py#L793
`program_folder` is set to the executable and not the path.

Quick fix:

~~~ diff
- program_folder = ext_programs[program].split("/")[-1] 
+ program_folder = os.path.dirname(ext_programs[program])

title: [BUG] hardcoded DISPLAY=:0 under wayland, can't launch built-in wine utilities
body:
**Describe the bug**
Bottles, when run under Wayland (with XWayland available), is unable to launch built-in wine utilites (Wine Config, Registry Editor, etc) when DISPLAY is not `:0`.

Attempting to launch them causes errors to be printed:
```
00b8:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Application tried to create a window, but no driver could be loaded.
00b8:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
```

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak (installed from Flathub)
 - Version: 2021.8.14-treviso
 - Also tried installing the AUR package without Flatpak and see similar behaviour.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run Bottles on a Wayland system with a working XWayland implementation.  I'm using the latest Arch Linux KDE plasma-wayland session.  Ensure that Xwayland is running for a display other than `:0`.  In my environment, it always seems to be `:1`.
2. Create a bottle.  Both Gaming and Software seem to have the same problem.
3. Once the bottle is created, try to run built-in Wine utilities, like `Wine Config` or `Registry Editor`
4. The utility does not launch.  If you're able to view the output from the Bottles process, you will see error messages about creating the window, as mentioned above.

**Expected behavior**
The utility will launch.

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Arch Linux x86-64 (KDE plasma-wayland session)
 - Version: latest packages as of August 25, 2021.

**Additional context**
Running Bottles under the plasma X11 session does not produce the problem - the utilities display just fine.  If I unset WAYLAND_DISPLAY from the environment before running bottles, then all of bottles uses X11, and the problem does not occur either.

This issue looks related to #419.  I notice that the fix for that issue hardcodes DISPLAY=:0 in the environment.

Maybe the code should be something more like:
```py
        if "WAYLAND_DISPLAY" in os.environ and "DISPLAY" in os.environ:
            # workaround https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/issues/419
            environment_vars.append("DISPLAY=" + os.environ["DISPLAY"])
```
?

title: [BUG] Bottles runs in Xwayland mode instead of running in wayland mode in the Flathub version
body:
**Describe the bug**
Bottles when installed from Flathub runs in Xwayland mode instead of running in wayland mode.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flathub
 - Version: 2021.7.28-treviso

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Boot your system in wayland mode
1. Run ```flatpak run com.usebottles.bottles``` to start Bottles
2. Run ```xprop``` in another terminal
3. Notice that the cursor changes to a plus sign when hovering over Bottles window indicating that Bottles is running in Xwayland mode.

**Expected behavior**
Bottles runs in native wayland mode and the wine applications run in Xwayland mode.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Version: n/a

**Additional context**
Bottles can be run in wayland mode by running ```flatpak run --socket=wayland com.usebottles.bottles``` But then wine applications will fail to start with the following error:
```
00c0:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Application tried to create a window, but no driver could be loaded.
00c0:err:winediag:nodrv_CreateWindow Make sure that your X server is running and that $DISPLAY is set correctly.
```

This can be fixed by passing the environment variable DISPLAY=:0 to wine applications. In this way Bottles will run in wayland mode and the wine applications will run in Xwayland mode. I suggest adding ```--socket=wayland``` to finish-args in ```com.usebottles.bottles.json``` file and adding the environment variable ```DISPLAY=:0``` to wine applications if Bottles was run in wayland mode.

title: [BUG] self.runner.get_running_processes() when splitting processes with | gets "index out of range"
body:
**Describe the bug**
The python task splitting bash command of running user processes to array crashes.

Length check only checks for >= 6 columns in `get_running_processes`, but the loop tries to get 7th index on the array. They are offset by 1.

**Installation**
 - Method: [AUR, so installing from source]
 - Version ["today?"]

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install some runners
2. Close Bottles
3. Relaunch

**Expected behavior**
Initialization proceeds beyond get_running_processes.

**Fix**

**Describe the bug**
I'm struggling after migration from flatpac. I had installed app image recently when you notified the impending doom of flatpac. However, my program wouldn't run from the app image, so I continued flatpac version. Today the flatpac no longer worked. Regrettably, I uninstalled my program, thinking I would reinstall on the new bottles and it should work. Now my program, which had been successfully running on the flatpac version will not install in bottles. When I click on "Run Executable", nothing happens. I thought I migrated my files successfully, but maybe not? I don't know how to verify, or where exactly they should go.

I reinstalled the app image of the latest release and am trying to use it. Here's what it does when I open from the app image:

title: [BUG] Debian/ubuntu packaging does not work
body:
**Describe the bug**
After installing the latest stable .deb version from Releases page, bottles fails to start:
```
bash: /usr/bin/bottles: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.10/x64/bin/python3: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
```


Start of the file `/usr/bin/bottles`: 
```
#!/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.8.10/x64/bin/python3

# bottles.in
...
```


It seems like it expects python 3.8.10 to be installed in the /opt dir.

I believe the issue is with Github Actions, since you are providing exactly this path to the env (https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles/runs/2863701538?check_suite_focus=true) Lines 5 and 6

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61112084/123452227-e2406f00-d5e6-11eb-9263-ef0b664d5c30.png)




**Installation**
 - Method: .deb file
 - Version 3.1.15

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install .deb file
2. Try to launch bottles
4. See error


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Pop!_OS 20.04

title: [BUG] Virtual desktop setting doesn't work
body:
Thanks a lot for creating and maintaining Bottles! It's a great application and makes using Wine fun. Wine is tedious and annoying for me to use normally. Thanks to Bottles I can just get stuff done on Linux.

**Describe the bug**

If you open a bottle, then go to the Preferences tab, there's an option called "Use a virtual desktop".

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25111343/122305921-9b12f980-ced5-11eb-8b2c-6e2d7e751a3a.png)

This setting doesn't actually change anything, even after rebooting the bottle (not sure what rebooting does in this context). The fact that the setting doesn't affect the bottle can be seen by running the desired EXE again, but also by opening the Wine config application.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25111343/122305968-b1b95080-ced5-11eb-8c9f-4ba58e11f93d.png)

Going to the Graphics tab will show that the virtual desktop is not enabled.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25111343/122306086-df05fe80-ced5-11eb-8668-69b0bc20e38c.png)

The only way I've found to make the virtual desktop setting work is to enable it from the Wine config.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 3.1.14 according to the in-app info, but Flatpak says I've installed version 3.1.11

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a bottle
2. Run an EXE and observe how there's no virtual desktop
3. Enable the virtual desktop setting in the GUI
4. Reboot the bottle
5. Run the EXE again or open the Wine config and observe how there's still no virtual desktop

**Expected behavior**

The virtual desktop GUI toggle and setting should affect the Wine config.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch Linux

title: [BUG] ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'gi'
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to run Bottles, it errors out with this message:
```py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/bottles", line 43, in <module>
    import gi
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'gi'
```

**Installation**
 - Method: [Arch User Repository - bottles-git](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/bottles-git/)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install the `bottles-git` repository from the AUR using any AUR helper or directly using `makepkg`
2. Run the `bottles` command in the terminal
3. See error: `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'gi'`

**Expected behavior**
The Bottles GUI launches without any crashes.

**Desktop**

 - Kernel Version:  `5.11.15-arch1-2`

title: [BUG] Wrong dates for releases
body:
**Describe the bug**
Wrong date against versions, which may lead to users believing they have an older build than it actually is.

3.1.5 has been marked as released on 2020-04-20, when it is actually **2021**-04-20

This is being brought up from `com.usebottles.bottles.appdata.xml.in` being incorrect.

Are you happy for me to do a PR and I will attach this issue to it?

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 3.1.5

**To Reproduce**
Look at releases

**Expected behavior**
The dates for all the 3.x releases should be 2021, not 2020.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/472320/115688991-90176f00-a353-11eb-9d70-020513c64724.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version 33

title: [BUG] Deleting a bottle "breaks" the GUI
body:
**Describe the bug**
If you have two or more Bottles and you delete one, you won't be able to configure the other ones, unless you restart the app.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 3.1.4

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Launch Bottles using the terminal so you can see the errors.
2. Create two bottles.
3. Delete the first one.
4. Try to change settings of the second bottle.
5. This message will show up in the console:

    ````bash
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/pages/list.py", line 180, in show_details
        self.window.show_details_view(configuration=self.configuration)
      File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/window.py", line 237, in show_details_view
        self.page_details.set_configuration(configuration)
      File "/app/share/bottles/bottles/pages/details.py", line 595, in set_configuration
        self.switch_dxvk.handler_block_by_func(self.toggle_dxvk)
    TypeError: nothing connected to <bound method BottlesDetails.toggle_dxvk of <details.BottlesDetails object at 0x7fa77e865ec0 (BottlesDetails at 0x55918ff6b3e0)>>
    ````

6. Only restarting the app fixes it, as far as I could tell.

**Expected behavior**
Deleting a bottle shouldn't "break" the GUI.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Version: rolling release

**Additional context**
N/A

title: [BUG] Clicking the Run.exe button makes Bottles to crash silently
body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm unable to run any exe from the Bottles GUI. Every time I click the Run.exe button, the GUI crashes silently without reporting any issue.

**Workaround**
I was able to to install PhotoLine and ColorMania by using the context menu from File manager (which is great).
But many of the other exe installers just do nothing and even no issue/error/exception is reported. Also the context menu doesn't work when Bottles GUI is open, I always have top close it first.

**Installation**
 - Method: AppImage
 - Version: 3.0.9, 3.1.0

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run Bottles and create a new Bottle (software mode)
2. Click on Run.exe button or the icon button next to the Bottle name.
3. The Bottles GUI crashes/closes without reporting anything

**Expected behavior**
When something goes wrong, Bottles should report some issue or error. Otherwise, I have no idea what's going on when the GUI just silently closes.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Manjaro Linux x86_64
 - Kernel: 5.10.19-1-MANJARO 
 - GNOME 3.38.3 

**Additional context**
I love the GUI, it looks awesome and provides all the relevant information, but problem is that it silently crashes without reporting any issue.

**Questions**
1. Is there some log file created to see what happens with the GUI?
2. Is there some way to see what happens when I run exe file (using context menu) and it does nothing?
3. What is a recommended method to upgrade Bottles using AppImage, I downloaded version 3.1.0 AppImage, run it and it created another instance in my applications dir (so had to delete manually the previous version).

title: [BUG] Enabling the DXVK Option of a bottle makes games crash on startup
body:
**Description**
Enabling the DXVK Option of a bottle makes any game or direct x accelerated application crash on start. Disabling DXVK fixes the crash. This crash does not happen if I use the wine package from fedora and their dxvk package. The crash happens with all available DXVK versions.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 3.0.9

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create a bottle. I used the custom configuration with its defaults.
2. Click on 'Preferences' in the headerbar.
3. Enable the option 'Use DXVK'
4. Now launch an exe that uses DXVk like a game (in my case Hellgate London).
5. The game does not launch and crashes.

**Expected behaviour**
The game launches without crashing on startup with DXVK enabled.

**Screenshots**
![Bildschirmfoto von 2021-03-14 14-17-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41188546/111070020-0fea2800-84d0-11eb-93be-0e3714e09a1d.png)
![Bildschirmfoto von 2021-03-14 13-46-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41188546/111069956-c568ab80-84cf-11eb-85ad-954f277196ab.png)

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version: 33

 - Method:  Flatpak

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Click on the plus-button in the headerbar on the left.
2. Click on 'custom' under 'Choose an environment' in the popup that opens.
3. Click on the cog wheel of one of the entries in the 'Advanced options' menu.

title: [BUG] chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner can only be selected in bottles if bottles gets restarted
body:
**Describe the bug**
The chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner can only be selected in bottles if bottles gets restarted. After installing chardonnay-6.3-unstable via the preferences menu and creating a bottle afterwards, the runner cannot be selected in the bottle till bottles gets restarted. It also missed the 64bit version and only showed the 32bit version.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 3.0.7

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Click the hamburger menu icon.
2. Click on 'Preferences'.
3. Scroll down to 'Wine Runners'.
4. Install the chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner.
5. Close the menu and go to the main screen.
6. Create a bottle. I used the gaming environment.
7. Click on the newly created bottle.
8. Click on 'Preferences' in the header bar.
9. Scroll to 'System'.
10. Click on 'Runner' (not the cog wheel).
11. The chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner should be available in the 32bit and 64bit version, but it isn't.

**Expected behaviour**
The chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner should be available in the 32bit and 64bit version in the menu.

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version 33

title: [BUG] chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner can be downloaded even though its already installed
body:
**Describe the bug**
The chardonnay-6.3-unstable runner can be downloaded even though its already installed. It installed successfully and can be selected in an bottle.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version 3.0.7

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Start bottles and click the hamburger menu Icon.
2. Click on 'Preferences'.
3. Scroll down to 'Wine Runners'.
4. Download the 'chardonnay-6.3-unstable' runner.
5. Close bottles and restart it.
6. Click on 'Preferences'.
7. Scroll down to 'Wine Runners'.
8. The 'chardonnay-6.3-unstable' runner can be downloaded again even though it is already there.

**Expected behaviour**
The 'chardonnay-6.3-unstable' runner can not be downloaded again as it is already there.

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version 33

title: [BUG] Enable ACO Option gets disabled after bottles restart
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I create a new bottle, I set can enable the ACO Shader Compiler when I go into the preferences menu. When I restart bottles and go back to the preferences, the ACO Shader Compiler Option is disabled again.

**Installation**
 - Method:Flatpak
 - Version 3.0.7

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Create a bottle with the gaming environment.
2. Click on the created bottle.
3. Click 'Preferences' in the header bar.
4. Enable the 'Enable ACO shader compiler' option.
5. Restart botlles.
6. Click on the previously created bottle.
7. Click 'Preferences' in the header bar.
8. The 'Enable ACO shader compiler' option is disabled even though it got enabled before.

**Expected behaviour**
The 'Enable ACO shader compiler' option should stay enabled.

**Desktop:**
 - OS: Fedora
 - Version: 33

title: [BUG] Fails to run executables inside the bottle
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you try to run an .exe file via the dashboard button, nothing happens.

**Installation**
 - Method: Flatpak
 - Version: 2.0.9

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run bottles in a terminal: `flatpak run com.usebottles.bottles`
2. Create a bottle
3. Go to the bottle's dashboard
4. *Turn off esync.* Otherwise it will make A LOT OF NOISE in the console and you won't be able to discern anything useful.
5. Run an .exe file in the dashboard
6. Select any .exe file at all
7. Nothing happens, observe a particular error in the terminal

**Expected behavior**
The installer for my game or whatever it is I'm trying to set up starts.

**Screenshots**
Console log:
```
2021-01-08 23:13:42 INFO: Setting Key: [esync] to [False] for bottle: [Gaming] …
2021-01-08 23:13:48 INFO: Running an executable on the wineprefix …
wineserver: using server-side synchronization.
MESA-INTEL: warning: Performance support disabled, consider sysctl dev.i915.perf_stream_paranoid=0

MESA-INTEL: warning: Performance support disabled, consider sysctl dev.i915.perf_stream_paranoid=0

/lib/ld-linux.so.2: could not open
```
This is all that appears whenever I attempt to run a program.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Xubuntu
 - Version: 20.04

**Additional context**
Could be the actual problem behind #90.

It is worth noting that by default, the Flatpak version requests two filesystem permissions that I used Flatseal to deny: `~/Games` and `~/wineprefixes`. I have neither directory and I want neither directory. Don't make presumptions on which non-hidden directories are okay to create or access. In addition, it's likely a good idea to use `$XDG_DATA_HOME` instead of hardcoding `~/.local/share`.

title: [BUG] Using bottles on nonFHS systems (e.g. NixOS)
body:
**Describe the bug**
I wanna maintain a `bottles` package for NixOS. Therefore I have written a (not yet polished) nix derivation (see under "Additional context"). The packaging itself is correct and `bottles` execute without any further error.

If you try to create a bottle, `bottles` respectively the `lutris/proton/…` runner throws an error (see https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/108256). The problem here is that the runners are downloaded from the github releases without further patching, what is unproblematic for the most Linux systems, but not for NixOS.

NixOS has a store concept, what means the most files aren't at the place you would expect it to be. The extracted runners are now trying to use the loader `/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2` and don't find the LD binary. Actually the binary is somewhere like `/nix/store/1yvpgm763b3hvg8q4gzpzmflr5674x4j-glibc-2.32-10/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2`.

Normally you circumvent this situation with something like `patchelf` or using `autopatchelf`, but this is only applies to packaging. As the binaries are extracted at runtime, patching them would be required also at runtime, either from `bottles` itself or maually from the user (through `patchelf` e.g.). Both solutions are not that perfect, I think.

A better solution could be packaging the different runners in seperate namespace, so they could be installed through the different tools (declarative, through `nix-env`, etc.), e.g. `nixos.bottlesRunner.lutris-6.0-rc1-x86_64`; this would allow patching them.

But therefore it would be needed that `bottles` looks for pre-installed runners. I don't know if it's better to load them directly from the nix-store or copy them to `$XDG_DATA_HOME/bottles/runners` before using them.

Please let me know what you think about that topic. :+1: 

**Installation**
 - Method: Meson build
 - Version: 270a0ba

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Compile the given nix derivation.
2. Execute `bottles`.
3. Create a new bottle.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The runner binaries execute without any further error.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: NixOS
 - Version: 20.09 (Nightingale)

**Additional context**

Nix file:

```
{ stdenv
, fetchurl
, python3Packages
, meson
, ninja
, pkgconfig
, itstool
, gettext
, gtk3
, python3
, glib
, gdk-pixbuf
, gobject-introspection
, gnome3
, gtksourceview4
, json-glib
, gspell
, gsettings-desktop-schemas
, desktop-file-utils
, wine
, libnotify
, wrapGAppsHook
}:

python3Packages.buildPythonApplication rec {
  pname = "bottles";
  version = "2.0.9.1";

  src = fetchurl {
    url = "https://github.com/bottlesdevs/${pname}/archive/${version}.tar.gz";
    sha256 = "0f3aqd2jyg81xsb71zx3ljzhk41jgn9pnw7mf9k80p213k4z0p40";
  };

  nativeBuildInputs = [
    meson
    ninja
    itstool
    gettext
    wrapGAppsHook
    gobject-introspection
  ];
  
  buildInputs = [
    glib
    gtk3
    json-glib
    gspell
    gobject-introspection
    gsettings-desktop-schemas
    desktop-file-utils
    gdk-pixbuf
    libnotify
    wine
  ];
  
  propagatedBuildInputs = with python3Packages; [
    pycairo
    pygobject3
    lxml
    dbus-python
    gst-python
    liblarch
  ];

  format = "other";
  strictDeps = false; # broken with gobject-introspection setup hook https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/56943
  doCheck = false; # why?
  dontWrapGApps = true; # prevent double wrapping
  
  preConfigure = ''
    substituteInPlace build-aux/meson/postinstall.py \
      --replace "'update-desktop-database'" \
                "'${desktop-file-utils}/bin/update-desktop-database'"
  '';
  
  preFixup = ''
    makeWrapperArgs+=("''${gappsWrapperArgs[@]}")
  '';

  postPatch = ''
    chmod +x build-aux/meson/postinstall.py
    patchShebangs build-aux/meson/postinstall.py
  '';

  passthru = {
    updateScript = gnome3.updateScript {
      packageName = pname;
    };
  };

  meta = with stdenv.lib; {
    description = "Easily manage wine prefix in a new way! (Run Windows software and games on Linux)";
    homepage = "https://github.com/bottlesdevs/Bottles";
    license = licenses.gpl3Only;
    maintainers = with maintainers; [ bloomvdomino ];
    platforms = platforms.linux;
  };
}
```

title: [Bug] - Error when using special characters in Bottles v1
body:
Your hint (*Microsoft Office*) implies that the user can name the prefix whatever they want including having spaces, which doesn't work.

Here's the relevant error message:
```python
Error: [BOTTLE_NAME_ERROR] Bottle name can not contain special characters
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/share/com.github.mirkobrombin.bottles/bottles/headerbar.py", line 125, in on_save_clicked
    self.wine.create_bottle(name, arch)
  File "/usr/share/com.github.mirkobrombin.bottles/bottles/wine.py", line 274, in create_bottle
    if self.check_special_chars(name):
  File "/usr/share/com.github.mirkobrombin.bottles/bottles/wine.py", line 259, in check_special_chars
    message_dialog = Gtk.MessageDialog.new_with_image_from_icon_name(
AttributeError: type object 'MessageDialog' has no attribute 'new_with_image_from_icon_name'
```

In my opinion the most user friendly way (maybe not the simplest) would be to add an error message if the name contains special characters.
